additionalHouseRules:
No refunds for weather related issues.  This includes lack of snow.
$5 per key cash deposit & $45 gate remote deposit where applicable
 Chains, snow tires, or 4-wheel drive mandatory during ice or snow

This is a vacation rental agreement under the North Carolina Vacation Rental Act.  The rights and obligations of the parties to this agreement are defined by law and include unique provisions permitting the disbursement of rent prior to tenancy and expedited eviction of tenants.  Your signature on this agreement, or payment of money, or taking possession of the property after receipt of this agreement, is evidence of your acceptance of the agreement and your intent to use this property for a vacation rental.  Rentals exceeding 90 days do not fall under the NC vacation rental management act and are not subject to the same protections adhered to by the NC Vacation Rental Management Act.

Maximum occupancy must be strictly adhered to.  Occupancy count includes children.  Exceeding the occupancy limit set for your unit is ground for immediate eviction.  No exceptions and no refunds!

Accidental Damage Protector & Security Deposits:  The Accidental Damage Protection Plan is included in the advertised total amount and indemnifies you and your family up to $1500 for any accidental damage during your stay. All accidental damage must be reported to our office in writing by the end of renter’s stay in order for Damage Protector to apply.  Damage Protector is a surety contract and is not insurance.  RRR is not an insurer, insurance agent or underwriter.  The Accidental Damage Protection is non refundable.  Damage Protector does NOT cover intentional damage, excessive cleaning, theft, Acts of God, gross negligence, pet damage, utilities, rent, pay for view cable charges, additional costs incurred during stay per renter’s request, or loss of use.  Any intentional property damage or items listed above will be billed to the renter and may be charged to renter’s account or credit card on file without renter’s consent if RRR is unable to contact renter to request authorization.  

A security deposit can be elected in lieu of Accidental Damage Protection.  The cost ranges from $200 to $800 depending on the rental unit.  It is fully refundable by mail within 30 days of departure providing no damages have been made to the unit and the unit has been left tidy (according to our check out procedures) or (less any allowable deductions).  The security deposit can be paid in advance by personal check, money order, certified funds or credit card. Security deposits paid upon arrival must be paid by cash or credit card only. 

A few homes may require an additional security deposit beyond what is required above in this rental agreement.  The renter agrees to reimburse the homeowner for any damages to the property caused by renter that are in excess of, or not covered by Damage Protector or the security deposit.  Such damages shall include reasonable attorney fees and court costs.  The provisions of Article 5, Chapter 42A of the North Carolina General Statutes (Landlord and tenant Duties) are incorporated herein by reference as if fully set forth.

The renter fully understands that RRR is a rental agency engaging in the rental of private property of others.  RRR reserves the right to refuse service to anyone RRR feels will not be responsible for the property he/she is renting. RRR does not rent to anyone under the age of 21.  Each rental unit requires a person 21 or older to rent and sign the rental contract.  This person must be present at check-in and for duration of rental.  Renter understands that RRR has the right to terminate this agreement, re-enter the unit, or take necessary measures to remove the renter from the premises in the event renter and guests violates the conditions of this agreement.  RRR is not responsible for the loss or theft of clothing, money, jewelry, etc. and is not be held liable for any accidents or injury of any nature.  RRR reserves the right to move any reservation that might come about due to unforeseen circumstances (house sold, out of rental program, owner’s use, act of God, etc.)  Under no circumstances is the obligation of RRR more than that of refunding the renter’s deposit. Rates are subject to all applicable taxes.  Rates are subject to change with notice.

Accommodations: All of our vacation properties are individually owned and reflect each owner’s taste.  Rearranging of furniture is not permitted. If you have specific standards or requirements for your vacation residence we advise personal inspection of the property prior to making reservations. Burning wood in any gas fireplace is prohibited and subject to forfeiture of security deposit.  Grilling is not permitted on any porches, decks or walkways.  All units are provided with enough garbage bags, paper towels, dishwashing detergent, bath soap, and toilet paper to get you started.  If you need more of these items, you can purchase them at Food Lion located on Tynecastle Hwy or other local grocery stores.  Firewood is NOT provided.  Propane/grill accessories are NOT provided. A one-time linen fee is charged on all units.  Linens are provided with initial set-up.  Additional linens/towels are not provided.  Towels for pools and/or hot tubs are not provided. There is a fee for extras and exchanges.

Renter agrees to indemnify and hold harmless RRR and the owner from and against any liability for personal injury or property damage sustained by any person (including renter’s guests) as a result of any cause, unless caused by the negligent or willful act of RRR or the owner, or the failure of the RRR or the owner to comply with the Vacation Rental Act.  Renter agrees that RRR, the owner or their respective representatives may enter the premises during reasonable hours to inspect the premises, to make such repairs, alterations or improvements thereto as RRR or owner may deem appropriate, or to show the premises to perspective purchasers or renters.

RRR does not guarantee any weather, road or ski conditions and there will be no refund as a result of either.  Transportation is the sole responsibility of the renter.  Snow tires, chains or 4-wheel drive is mandatory during adverse weather as stated by Sugar Mountain law.

There will be no refund for weather related issues.  This includes but is not limited to lack of snow or inclement weather preventing the renters’ arrival.  We strongly recommend accepting the travel insurance to assist with obtaining refunds for these situations. No refunds are made for early departures or no shows.

Travel Insurance: We offer travel insurance through Red Sky Travel Insurance.  This provides coverage should you need to cancel or interrupt your trip as well as primary medical coverage, coverage for lack to snow and much more.  Please read your “Description of Coverage” for details.  If no computer access, please ask us to send you a copy of the Insurance Policy. Insurance premiums are non-refundable.

Check-in: Check in starts at 4:00 pm. RRR does not guarantee check-in time. Check in at our office.  No early check-ins are guaranteed.  Renters are not permitted to enter the unit without first coming to the office and checking in.  No entry is allowed until units are cleaned and inspected.  There is a refundable $5.00 per key deposit (cash only) due at check-in.  There is also a refundable $45.00 deposit on community gate remotes where applicable (cash or credit card only).  Our office hours are from 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Monday through Friday and 5 p.m. on Saturdays with extended hours during ski season (including Sundays).  If you will be arriving after regular office hours there will be a late arrival packet left for you in the green “Check-in” box at the front of our office.  This is provided if you have paid in full and have a signed contract.  The packet will have your name on the front and inside you will find a map to the unit(s), one key, and emergency phone numbers in case of a problem.  NO arrivals on Thanksgiving or Christmas Day as our offices are closed.  Upon check in, if you have any housekeeping issues or other issues related to the comfort of your stay, please contact our office immediately to report specifics.  There will be no refunds upon checkout for issues that were never reported immediately upon check-in or during your stay.

Check-out:  10:00 a.m. All units must be vacated by 10:00 a.m. on the scheduled departure date and keys returned to office unless PRIOR arrangements have been made for late check-out.  Failure to check out on time will result in a $50 late check-out fee.  Failure to comply with check out procedures listed below will result in additional charges.

Before checking out please do the following steps:
Tidy Unit
Load and start dishwasher
Clean out refrigerator – do not leave any food in kitchen
Take out all trash to appropriate receptacles (trash MUST be bagged)
Turn off all lights
Unplug small appliances
Turn thermostats (heat) back to 55 degrees in winter
Lock and secure all windows and doors

Ordinances: 
Most properties limit number of vehicles and parking spaces.  Parking is not permitted on town streets.  Renter is responsible for any fees incurred due to parking in prohibited areas.  No oversized vehicles are allowed in parking areas without prior permission from RRR.  Buses and oversized vehicles are prohibited on the mountain except in designated areas. 
Town ordinance prohibits loose dogs on the mountain.  All dogs must be kept on a leash.
Quiet Hours are from 11 p.m. to  8 a.m. on Sugar Mountain.  After one notice, if tenant fails to adhere to this regulation it will result in an immediate eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid

Daily Maid Service: is not provided.  We can, however, arrange extra cleaning services for you at an additional charge. Must have 48 hours advance notice.

Lock Out Policy: During office hours you may pick up an extra key at our office.  After hours, one of our agents will meet you at the office.  There is a $25 charge for this service.

Locked Closets:  Most units have one or more locked closets which are not available to guests.  These doors are checked behind each guest.  Tenant will be responsible for any damage or missing items.  Criminal charges could result.

Repairs and Service Calls: Please report any inoperative equipment to our office promptly.  We cannot guarantee appliances, TV’s, heaters, gas logs, cable or internet, etc. and no refund or rate adjustments will be made for any mechanical failure including power outages.  We do not refund for malfunctioning hot tubs. We will, however, make every effort to have repairs done quickly or reasonably remedy the problem.

Telephones: Most units have telephones.  Some are set up for 911 services only.  Please charge all long distance calls to your credit card, calling card, or home phone.  There will be an additional $10.00 service charge on any calls charged to the unit phone number.  Local prefixes 898, 733, 737, 387 and 964 only.  All others are long distance including Foscoe, Boone and Blowing Rock.

Pets:  Absolutely NO pets are allowed unless otherwise permitted by RRR.  You must call for permission.  A pet deposit of $100 per pet is mandatory and is not refundable. Breach of this policy will result in immediate eviction and loss of monies.  No pets are allowed between December 1st and March 15th. 

Smoking: Absolutely no smoking in units.  Failure to adhere will result a fumigation charge and immediate eviction.

Waiver of Liability for Spa, Hot Tub, Jacuzzi, Sauna and Pool: The renter understands that there are special risks involved in the use of above special features.  Renter is aware there are potential dangers these features may present to children and adults that are not carefully supervised, as well as any person using special feature too long or if a person has health risks or is intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or pregnant.  Renter agrees to waive any claim whatsoever against RRR and owner of property for accidents or injury arising from use of special features.  The renter agrees he/she is responsible and liable for any damages that occur to the special feature through his or his guest’s misuse or negligence.  If a hot tub has to be drained and refilled due to foreign substances in the water, there will be an extra charge to the renter for this service and it will be charged to renter’s account or credit card.

Units listed for Sale: Renter agrees to allow unit to be shown promptly.  24 hour notice will be given.

Property Transfer: In the event the Owner transfers this property prior to occupancy by renter, renter has the right to enforce this agreement if the rental is to end 180 days or less after the transfer of ownership.  If more than the above 180 days, renter has no enforcement rights unless the Grantee agrees to honor this rental; however, renter has a right to a refund of all monies paid.  RRR will promptly notify renter if property is transferred.

Mail: We do not accept mail for renters renting less than one month.  If renting for a month or more mail may be forwarded to our office. Mail will be picked up daily and will be available at our office after 2 p.m. if possible.  RRR is not personally responsible or liable for any lost or damaged mail.

Illegal Acts: Absolutely no acts illegal by law are allowed in RRR units or on premises.  Any such action will result in immediate eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid.  Any excessive cleaning or damage caused by these acts will be charged to the renter.

primaryHost/about:
We are a premier vacation rental management company located in Sugar Mountain, NC near the Blue Ridge Parkway and Grandfather Mountain. Currently we manage over 150 properties varying from Cabins, Mountain Homes, Chalets and Condos.  Once a reservation is made, our reservationists will contact you via email, with a Rental Agreement. All guests must sign and return a Rental Agreement within 7 days to guarantee your reservation.
YOU MUST Check-IN and Check-OUT at 3390 Tynecastle Highway,  Sugar Mountain NC 28604. DO NOT go directly to your rental location.
You will receive a welcome pack containing a Guest Guide, map and Keys to your vacation rental.
ITS SWEETER UP HERE!
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully decorated and spacious condo is located in the Reserve II gated community on Sugar Mountain. With an elevation of 4800 feet you can enjoy unobstructed breathtaking long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

This beautifully decorated and spacious condo is located in the Reserve II gated community on Sugar Mountain. With an elevation of 4800 feet you can enjoy unobstructed breathtaking long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. There is a convenient trail across the parking lot from the condo that leads to the ski slopes. The walk is 300 yards or less.  Great for ski access or mountain biking without having to endure parking hassles.  Not only are you a stones throw from all the amenities that Sugar Mountain has to offer, you are only a short drive from Banner Elk, Boone and Blowing Rock which offers the best in dining, shopping, golf and outdoor activities. Relax in the comfortable living room with a stone gas fireplace and large flat screen smart TV. The master bedroom features a king size bed and private bath with Jacuzzi tub and walk in shower.  The guest room features a queen bed with adjoining bath. There is also a queen sleeper sofa. Enjoy cooking in the fully furnished gourmet kitchen with all stainless steel appliances. Wi-Fi is provided.No Smoking  *ONLY TWO(2) PARKING PERMITS PER UNIT. VEHICLES WITHOUT PERMITS WILL BE TOWED AT THE OWNER'S EXPENSE* Absolutely NO Pets.  Max occupancy is 4. 4x4/awd, chains or snow tires needed in winter. No Check-in's Thanksgiving Day or Christmas Day. All guests required to sign rental agreement upon booking.

additionalHouseRules:
QUIET HOURS: 
10:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m.

PET POLICY:
Up to (1) dog per accommodation is permitted (with the exception of Pit Bulls or Pit Mixes, which are expressly prohibited) with a nonrefundable $50 cleaning fee, and the guest must agree to and abide by the Hotel Pet Policy & Agreement form.  

IMPORTANT!  A $200 charge will be applied to the customer's credit card if it is determined that unreported animals have been kept in the rooms. 

LATE CHECK-OUT/OVERSTAY:
For patrons staying past check-out time, a fee of no less than $50 will be charged, up to/including another day's rental fee should the infringement cause another incoming guest to lose their reservation.

name: Room 2 at Bramwell Adventures-2 Min. to Trail!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront, pet-friendly* rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails. If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby. *See Pet Policy in House Rules.

Room 2 is a single-room efficiency on the riverfront with a kitchenette, private bathroom and shower, 1 double bed, and

1 twin bed over a double bunk bed for a maximum capacity of 5 guests.  The kitchenette is equipped with a compact refrigerator, 2-eye hotplate, dishes, pots, pans, cooking and eating utensils, coffee pot and microwave oven. Rooms 1 and 2 are connected by a lockout door and may be rented together for a party of up to 12. WiFi is included, as well as onsite parking for trailers, trucks, and ATVs at no additional cost to our guests.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  Pets require an additional cleaning fee and guests must agree to pet policy.  (See House Rules for details.)  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
QUIET HOURS: 
10:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m.

PET POLICY:
Up to (1) dog per accommodation is permitted (with the exception of Pit Bulls or Pit Mixes, which are expressly prohibited) with a nonrefundable $50 cleaning fee, and the guest must agree to and abide by the Hotel Pet Policy & Agreement form.  

IMPORTANT!  A $200 charge will be applied to the customer's credit card if it is determined that unreported animals have been kept in the rooms. 

LATE CHECK-OUT/OVERSTAY:
For patrons staying past check-out time, a fee of no less than $50 will be charged, up to/including another day's rental fee should the infringement cause another incoming guest to lose their reservation.

sectionedDescription/access: Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.
sectionedDescription/description:
#1 Hatfield McCoy Trails Lodging

       The Busted ATV Resort in beautiful Bramwell, West Virginia, is the place to stay! Less than a mile ride from Hatfield McCoy trail head leading into over three hundred miles of trails. We are about 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park look out deck is just one mile from out front door.

Welcome to the McCoy Lodge.  The fully furnished lodge gives you space and privacy. Located at the top of Busted ATV Resort drive makes you king of the hill. Surrounded by the woods and located just six hundred feet from the peak of Mt. Me. There is a coin operated ATV pressure wash and washer and dryer.


This season has been filled with some awesome good times with new and old friends attending. For those of you that Ride Dirty, Sleep Clean  - thank you!  With your continued support My great friend Rob and I will continue to build Busted A in way that's perfect for all our needs. God bless!
Pat

How to find us?
 We are Located in Bramwell on Hwy 52 just one mile north of Pinnacle Rock state park . Don't always trust your GPS using addresses in WV. Tell your maps app. to take 
  you to Busted ATV Resort.



If you see any problems within the home upon entry we must be notified with in two hours of your arrival.

You are NOT responsible for washing linens or making the beds.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

Call or text anytime. 
386-2991121
386-5278881

About a half mile from the Pocahontas trail head located in beautiful Bramwell . From here you have access to over four hundred miles of Hatfield McCoy trails that include Pocahontas, Indian ridge, Pinnacle and Warrior trail systems. Want more? Just a short six mile ride will get you into the Virginia spearhead trails. Need even more trails? Hitch up the trailer and take a day trip further into coal county to find even more Hatfield McCoy trail systems.


Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a great price in-season months (April - October) is by winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to stay at Busted ATV Resort contact us first. We make several trips throughout the winter season and can discount your 3 night minim stay if it aligns with our schedule. 

The Busted ATV Resort, in beautiful Bramwell, West Virginia, is the place to stay! The remodeled historic 1880 Bramwell House and adjacent accommodations. , at the base of Mt. Me, offer spacious accommodations with plenty of easy access parking. About a half mile  ride from Hatfield McCoy trail head and 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park look out deck is just one mile from out front door.

name: Historic, fully equipped 2-bedroom apartment
sectionedDescription/description:
We are a family orientated facility, proud to offer quality large two-bedroom apartments featuring spacious private bathrooms, entertainment space, full kitchens. Bramwell, “Home of the Millionaires” is not to be missed!
We are ATV friendly and parking is available for trucks and trailers. The original Pocahontas Trailhead is just down the road. Pocahontas connects you to Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trail systems as well as outlaw trails.
This apartment has 1 king, 1 queen, & 1 full sleeper sofa.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Coaldale Condo
photos/4/caption: Large patio firepit, grill, tables chairs.
photos/14/caption: Bathroom
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.

This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.
sectionedDescription/interaction: When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.
sectionedDescription/notes: Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/space:
This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.
sectionedDescription/summary: This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.
sectionedDescription/transit: Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails.  If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

name: Miners Den
photos/14/caption: Kitchen and stacked washer/dryer
photos/16/caption: Kitchen facing living room
photos/20/caption: Front of FWH toward Miners Den
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br ADA unit is TRAILSIDE to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trails & Visitors Center at Coaldale, WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA. and to all Southern HMT Trails in WV, over 500 mi. On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1.

Experience rustic charm with all the amenities of home in Four Wheeler Heaven's newest unit, The Miners Den! This two bedroom, one bathroom unit sleeps 6-8 people and is wheelchair accessible. When you walk in, you'll be greeted by rustic decor and historical photos from Mercer, McDowell and Tazewell counties, including photos of coal miners from our own family. The large living room TV and complimentary Wi-Fi provide plenty of entertainment after a long day's ride.

The Miners Den comes fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot — basically everything you need to get started. You can cook for your whole group with a full kitchen, including an oven/stove, microwave, full-size refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher, coffeemaker and crockpot. The Miners Den also has its own washer/dryer unit. Trust us - you'll need it after a day on the trails!

An oversized bathroom with an ADA accessible toilet and shower provides easy access to persons with disabilities. The master bedroom features a queen bed, closet, and its own private HD TV. The second bedroom is a bunk room with four Twin XL beds - perfect for the kids or other members of your group. The Miners Den also has a roll-out bed in the living room couch that can sleep up to 2 additional people, for a total capacity of 8.

There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers so you can be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. The bunk room shares a lock-out door with the Coaldale Condo, our original two bedroom, one bathroom unit that sleeps up to 5 people. Groups that rent both the Miners Den and Coaldale Condo will have a total of four bedrooms and two bathrooms with a capacity of 13 people. 

Ride all four southern Hatfield-McCoy trails: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior. The Spearhead "Original Pocahontas" trail is a quick 4-mile ride up and over Coaldale Mountain Road. We also have a handy machine wash area on property and offer trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, FWH T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Ride your ATV or UTV right from our location to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead just 100 yards away!

sectionedDescription/description:
Sleeps up to 15 with additional space for air mattresses on 5 acres with two freshwater streams!  As of June 2020, we now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET. 
The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions.  Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

This 5 Bedroom with 2 full and 2 half bathroom home is located on 5 acres in beautiful southwestern Virginia.  
Easily found and accessible from Interstate 77 (13 miles) and Interstate 81 (40 miles).
First floor (main living floor) includes the kitchen, dining, den, laundry, ½ bath and master bed/bathrooms.
Second floor includes the living room, 3 bedrooms, 1 ½ bathrooms.
Third floor includes a finished room with 2 sets of bunk beds.
Other amenities include basic cable television, WIFI internet, washer/dryer and dish washer.
Outside you will find a large wrap around porch and large rear deck with great mountainous views.  A spacious yard with fire pit is bordered on two sides by separate freshwater streams that hold trout at certain times of the year.
We now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET

2 creeks 
Fire pit 
Walking trails

Available for all your questions phone, text or email.

The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions. Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

A wide driveway with egress from a paved county road (Rt. 61) provides entrance to the property and will accommodate multiple large pickup trucks pulling trailers (ATV’s, Horses, etc.) and will also allow excessive room for turn around.

name: A Bit Of Heaven Rental:Calvary House Warrior Trail
photos/1/caption: Perfect for families or small groups. Cozy, clean, comfortable relaxing area for after you have played on the trails all day.
photos/2/caption: Spacious living room with 65" TV.  Streaming firestick. High speed internet and wifi.
photos/3/caption:
Well stocked eat in kitchen with pots pans, dishes, utensils. Also has a crockpot,  mixer, and a toaster.
Perfect for preparing a meal when you return home.
photos/5/caption:
Bedroom #1 features 2 comfy Queen size beds with clean linens and extra blankets. Attached Jack and Jill Bathroom. 
Clothes hanging rod with hangers.
photos/6/caption:
Bedroom #2 features 2 comfy Queen size beds with clean linens and extra blankets. Attached Jack and Jill Bathroom.
Clothes hanging rod with hangers.
photos/7/caption: The main bathroom is a Jack and Jill bathroom located between the two bedrooms. Fully stocked with towels and anything you may need during your stay.
photos/8/caption: 5' deep tub with ceramic tile shower. Clean towels are also proviided.
photos/10/caption: Laundry area with washer and dryer.
photos/13/caption: Relax under the stars at night and enjoy time with your friends and family around the fire pit.
photos/14/caption: BBQ gas grill
photos/15/caption:
This house is a duplex. This unit sleeps 8, you can also book the Calvary Suite with it for larger groups. With both units will sleep a total of 14.
Fenced in private yard.
photos/16/caption: Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Pull through driveway off of back alley.
photos/18/caption: Electronic lock for fast and efficient check in
photos/20/caption: Road in the picture is Warriormine Rd. Located one street over Calvary. House is circled in blue.
photos/23/caption: Rick and I own A Scoop of Heaven. The best icecream in town. Stop by and say hey and we will give you 10% off.
photos/24/caption: The Owl serves inexpensive but tasty breakfast, lunch and dinner 6 days a week. Open 8am-8pm and 12 noon-5:30 on Sundays
photos/25/caption: Located directly around the corner of the Warrior trailhead office. Sells HMT passes as well as souvenirs.  Open from 9am-2 daily.
photos/26/caption: Berwind Lake boating, and trout fishing
primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart...
Surrounded by mountains and located just a stones throw away (1/4 mile) from Hatfield McCoy's trail head Warrior and many outlaw trails. Enjoy High Rocks and Wilmore Dam, or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, or hiking.
Easy access to restaurants, gas, and grocery store. We are an ATV friendly town and house is located in a friendly Quiet neighborhood with plenty of parking.

The house features 2 bedroom, 2 bath full house that sleeps 8 comfortable. Living room, eat in kitchen and laundry area. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishes, utensils, coffee maker, toaster anything you need. 
Fully equipped with towels, and clean linens are on all the beds. Also a wonderful porch with table, chairs and a propane grill to enjoy the outdoors.
The main bathroom is a Jack and Jill bath between the two bedrooms. 
Living room has a flat screen TV with a fire stick and WIFI.
Like us on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.
This house has a suite ( duplex) that can be rented for larger groups.

Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.

Our mission is to make your stay at The Calvary House as enjoyable as possible. 
 We are locally owned and located directly accross the street up on the hill if you need anything. 

 We respect your privacy . We'll give you the space that you want or the help you may need.

We are located around the corner from Warrior Trailhead office. Warrior Trail has direct connections to Pinnacle Creek, Indian Ridge and Pocahontas Trail. 
Located off RT 16 part of the 91 mile Head of the Dragon Motorcycle Ride in McDowell County. Surrounded by beautiful scenery.
 
Quiet Neighborhood in a welcoming small town with all the conveniences.  Restaurants, Grocery Store and gas station and car wash.

War is an ATV friendly town as well as the surrounding communities. 
You can ride in town and directly to the Trailhead.

Day Trips in the area:
86 Miles to New River Gorge
64 Miles to Beckley Exibition Coal Miner Youth Museum

** Check out our other Listings**
Calvary Suite
The Cove House
Cove Suite

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "The Fox Den"
photos/16/caption: A sunset you will never forget! Romantic Getaway!
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just above this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Fox Den is named and themed (decor) after Virginia State Trooper Andrew D. Fox.  Andrew was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate from Tazewell High School.  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.

name: Spacious ATV Retreat House

sectionedDescription/description:
The perfect ATV adventure home! This 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom home offers plenty of space for your friends and family as well as enough parking for 5 trailers. The home is also equipped with a washer and dryer, charcoal grill, basic cable and internet.  You will also have convenient access to ATV trails!  House is located close to the Pocahontas trailhead and is a short ride to both Indian Ridge and Pinnacle Creek trails. Enjoy getting away from the hustle and bustle and breathe in the fresh countr

This ATV retreat has 1 king bed, 2 queen beds, and 2 full beds. The home is wheel chair accessible throughout and has a wheelchair access ramp. There is also a large two car garage and plenty of outside parking space.  The kitchen is fully equipped and there is ample living space to spend time with your loved ones.

Coordinates of the house are: 37º21'15N 81º15'01W

If you need to rent ATVs for your trip we recommend using - WV ATV Rentals, Crazy Mountain Cycles or Eagle ATV Rentals.

NO SMOKING

sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet Neighborhood, cozy and functional. Two Bedrooms, Double Bed each. 
 Two Twin pull out couches.  Full Bath and Kitchen.  Picture window in Living Room with nice view of East River Mountain.  Full Garage makes it easy to load and unload groceries or luggage.  Friendly neighborhood great for walking, biking or running.  Nice backyard for kids to play.  Downstairs with washer and dryer available.

Quiet respectful neighborhood.  5 minutes to grocery.

name: Less than 1 minute to Warrior Trail access!
sectionedDescription/access: all of the property is at your disposable except the carage. that us our only storage space.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Creekside Cottage.. We are also located one minute off "Head of the Dragon" driving route #16! Newly updated home  in a quiet neighborhood.

Most furnishings in the home are new or like new!

all of the property is at your disposable except the carage. that us our only storage space.

Hope to have you as a guest in our home! We are not on property but assistance is just a few minutes away! And we are always here for questions and concerns.

Working class family quiet neighborhood

There is a car wash in town War.  The hillbillygas station sells permits and has free spare maps as well as the trail head office. The closest hospital is in Welch.

name: The Heartland Lodge w/50 amp RV site/full hookup
sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the whole house. House will be equipped with washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave. The house is fully stocked with everything you need with all your amenities like shampoo and soap to towels and washcloths to pots and pans. We will have trail maps available at the house for your convenience. We also have a grill and outdoor area with a fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
Recently completely remodeled and in a great location. Less than 1/2 a mile from the Hatfield and McCoy Warrior trailhead, gas station and grocery. The warrior trail connects to 3 other trails Indian ridge, Pocahontas, & Pinnacle. You can access 400+ miles of H&M trails and unlimited amount of outlaw. This house is within 3 miles of 7 restaurants, 2 grocery stores and 3 trails (warrior/pinnacle/Indian ridge) Everything is accessible by ATV! We are here to make your trip the best trip ever!

Best location in the area!! In the heart of Hatfield and McCoy. We are less than a 1/2 a miles from the warrior trail and within 3 miles of the connector trail to Indian ride and pinnacle. Also Indian ridge connects to Pocahontas! So 4 trails accessible from this house. Not to mention unlimited amount of outlaw trails close by. It’s also within 3 miles of the trail head to the wagon wheel/riders paradise!! This house is located within 3 miles of Wendy’s, McDonald’s, Subway, Pizza Hut, Sterling Drive-In, huddle hut, and KFC. It’s also within 3 miles of a four wheeler store and repair shop, car wash, 2 grocery stores, 3 gas stations, advance auto, shoe show, family dollar, dollar tree, hardware store, and mechanic shop. Its within a mile of 2 drug stores and a movie theatre! It’s within 1 mile of linkous park which has FREE tennis courts, a basketball court, walking path, and a nice playground for kids. There’s also a very nice outdoor pool there also! Theres a great outdoor area at the house for just setting around the campfire and enjoying the evening after a great day riding the Hatfield and McCoy trails, white water rafting, skiing, hunting, or hiking the great mountains of WV! All amenities are included and then some!!  We have grill, WiFi, washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, dish washer, 6 beds, and a fully stocked house with everything you need. We also have trail maps available at the house. Everything is accessible by ATV once you get here there’s no need to get back in your vehicle!! No trailering needed to get to any of these places!! If you need more room we have a nice camper that sleeps 10 that we can pull in and set up for additional guests. We also rent out kayaks and our Honda pioneer 1000 which is a 5 seater in a package deal if needed and we have a 50 amp full hookup for a camper. To use the hookup it will be an additional $50 a night to be paid at the time of booking. Ask for details on RV hookup or any of these extras we will have to do that outside of Airbnb..So come and enjoy some southern hospitality! We want you to make your trip a yearly experience! Come and enjoy the mountains of West Virginia!! Looking forward to seeing you soon!!

You will have access to the whole house. House will be equipped with washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave. The house is fully stocked with everything you need with all your amenities like shampoo and soap to towels and washcloths to pots and pans. We will have trail maps available at the house for your convenience. We also have a grill and outdoor area with a fire pit.

We are available for questions at anytime. We are here to make your stay one you will never forget and make into a yearly tradition!! We are local and will be happy to help you out in any way possible. Feel free to contact us at anytime! We look forward to accommodating your stay to West Virginia!!

Once you book your trip we will give you the access code to the door entrance.

name: Papa's Den Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails
sectionedDescription/access: The entire cabin.
sectionedDescription/description:
Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages are non-smoking, sleeps up to 4 people and provides all the comforts of home. We are located near the Hatfield & McCoy trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. Cottages and cabins include Heat / AC mini splits, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, refrigerator, three-quarter bath, 32” TV with Netflix/Directv, fresh linens, bath towels & housekeeping service. Outdoor fire pit and charcoal grill sit along Tug River. Privacy fence on premises.

Welcome to your home away from home! We’re committed to your comfort and adventure.

We are located with access to the Hatfield & McCoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. You can ride your ATV/SXS directly to the trails from our cabins! 

Our small to mid-size cottages and cabins sleep up to 4 people are efficiency style units with a loft, full size bed and three-quarter bath w/ shower, sink, toilet and towel rack. Heat / AC Mini Split units, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen with Keurig coffee-maker, microwave and refrigerator and 32″ Smart TV with Netflix. Charcoal grill, picnic table and firepit outside.

All fresh linens, complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, bath towels and wash cloths, grilling utensils, toilet paper, paper towels, firewood for the firepit are all included at no additional cost. Our cabins and cottages can be rented as a group, family or vacation getaway

There is also a second cabin “Bear Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails" and a third rental available,  "The Cave- 2 Bedroom Cabin- Hatfield McCoy” on Airbnb as well that sleeps up to 6 people. These cabins are located on the same property like a mini resort. There is plenty of parking for trailers and ATVs / SXS and easy access to Hatfield and McCoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails.

The entire cabin.

Drive directly to the Hatifield and McCoy trailheads on your SXS. 
Large Parking lot at the cabins.

We pride ourselves on your fun and crazy adventure while staying at Trail Bandits Cabins. Please help us keep it just as fun for our community and our fellow campers. Please read over our rental terms and conditions.

As always, remember to UNLEASH YOUR ADVENTURE!

Our Policy

Cabin rental incidental deposits are non-refundable if your reservation is cancelled with less than 30 days remaining before your arrival date.  Deposits for holiday/holiday weekends are not refundable under any conditions if cancelled.

Reschedule requests will be only be accepted if there are 30 days or longer remaining before your scheduled arrival date.  These requests are subject to availability. * Inclement weather cancellations will not be accepted.

Failure to adhere to your reservation with no communication will forfeit your deposit and you will be charged the remaining balance of your stay.

Cabin Terms and Conditions

Check-in time is 3pm on your arrival date, and check out time is 11am on your departure date. 

Guests will be charged a one time $50 cleaning fee at the time of reservation.

Cabins are non-smoking.  Guests will be charged a one time $250 cleaning fee if smoking is detected inside the cabins and you will forfeit your deposit.

The maximum capacity per standard cabin is 3 adults.  The maximum capacity for our larger cabin is 4 adults.   Violators will be evicted, and no refund will be issued.  Small children will be exempt from this rule. 

Playing on loft ladders is prohibited. Face the ladder when going up or down. Do not carry objects in your hands while on the ladder.

Park ONLY in the designated parking areas which is in front of your cabin or across the road in the grass area.  

Alcohol is permitted.  Disorderly conduct is not allowed.

*No atv or any off road vehicles are allowed in any of the rivers.

Please honor the posted speed limit in our atv community.  

The reserving guests will be responsible for any damages to your cabin or premises. 

Please do not place, burn or leave trash in your fire pit. Outside charcoal grills need to be cleaned prior to the departure of your stay.

We ask that all guest respect your fellow campers and community. 

Quiet the noise after 10:00pm for respect of the community and other campers.

No excessive riding in the cabin areas or driveways.   No driving or parking your ATV on the grass where the charcoal grills and picnic tables are located.

There are outdoor surveillance cameras around the campground for the protection of your items.

Ready to Reserve!

You must reserve with an incidental deposit of $250. Incidental deposits are refundable upon checkout as long as there are no damages or additional charges made. If additional charges or damages occur during your stay, you will receive the incidental deposit back less the cost of damages or additional charges. Cabins cannot be reserved and will not be held without a deposit.

All rentals require a 2-night minimum.

Pet Friendly – We love Pets!

Trail Bandits Cabins offers pet friendly cabins. 

Pets that are non-aggressive are allowed with a $50 per pet surcharge per night.  No more than 1 pet is allowed per cabin unless approved by host to have more.

All pets must be registered at check-in. If not registered and found on the premises, you will be evicted and deposit forfeited.

Excessive barking that is a disturbance to other campers will not be allowed.  

**Pets must be crated if left alone.

Pets should be on a leash at all times while outside. Please clean up any waste left by your pet.

Reserving guest is responsible for any damages caused by pets. If any damages occur, incidental deposit will be forfeited.

Pets must be 40 pounds or less due to insurance restrictions and campground policy procedures.

name: "Mad Men" 1 bedroom  apartment
photos/2/caption: Step back in time to the wonderful 70s in this cozy living room
photos/11/caption: The carport is 20 ft deep by 15 ft wide. Slab in front of carport is 19 ft long by 6 ft wide.
photos/15/caption: The most recent copy of the trail map.
photos/17/caption: With creative parking ideas and acceptable sized equipment this is how the carport could be utilized. The road is narrow and there is a stone wall across from the carport. This road is also a dead end and one lane
photos/18/caption: For a more accurate visual of the parking Dynamics this is from the back of the carport. Notice the stone wall?
primaryHost/about: I enjoy traveling to new places and meeting new people. my children are my favorite people on earth!
sectionedDescription/access: guess have entire apartment with private entrance and stairwell. the private fenced backyard with fire pit and comfortable patio chairs. large carport and Street side parking
sectionedDescription/description:
This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit.Located in the heart of Welch. Part of the Hatfield and McCoy trail system.

this basement apartment is like staying in a cozy nostalgic time capsule. located in a quiet, historic, beautiful Mountainside neighborhood. the extensive Stone walls and stairways is reminiscent of Villas in Italy. 360 degree Mountain views. overlook the river while enjoying the sound.

guess have entire apartment with private entrance and stairwell. the private fenced backyard with fire pit and comfortable patio chairs. large carport and Street side parking

guess can reach me by text or Airbnb messaging or if I am within sight

the neighborhood is composed of many big beautiful older homes. built on four different Mountainside tiers. this is a safe, quiet, friendly residential area. located on the very south east end of Welch. the downtown area is directly down Riverside Drive to the West. there is Renegade Outfitters for Trail Riders. 3 Exxon convenience stores and 1 Exxon gas station. two grocery stores within 3 miles or less. Dollar General and Family Dollar combo Dollar Store. a shoe show. one locally owned thrift store and one antique store all within three miles. the Pocahontas movie theater approximately one mile. McDonald's, KFC, Wendy's, Pizza Hut, Subway fast food restaurants within 3 miles or less. The Howdy house, Sterling Drive In,  spikes dawg house, and three little cupcakes bakery, independently owned restaurants all within six miles or less.

personal vehicle, walking, public transportation. best of all the town of Welch and many surrounding towns are ATV friendly. Therefore you can ride on most streets. trail connector signs are placed well to assist Riders.

there is plenty of ATV traffic on roads around location.
