additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a back yard.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 3BR 2BA house with pool, is located Trailside at the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead at Coaldale WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA and 500mi of OFF Road adventures from our location On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1

This upstairs unit features 3 bedroom, 2 full baths with a full kitchen, dining room, sun room, living room and a washer/dryer. It will sleep 10 or 12 and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker, full size fridge, oven, pots/pans, microwave and crock pot, grills, picnic tables, fire-pits, basically everything you need to cook or heat up your meals. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding or just kick back relax and enjoy the amenities. Direct "Trailhead" access to over 500 miles of West Virginia's Trails and Virginia's most popular trails. Ride Four Hatfield McCoy trail systems from our "Trailside" location: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle and the new Warrior Trails and Virginia's Spearhead trails. We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees. Discounts for multiple unit rentals (Coaldale Condo/Miners Den) available.Truly a Four Wheeler Heaven! Rent all three units for complete Privacy including the Pool Too ! Pool in season from Memorial to Labor Days.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a back yard.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes. Atv rentals are available near by

name: Cozy Hill Cabin - near Hatfield and McCoy’s Trails
sectionedDescription/access: Access to whole cabin.
sectionedDescription/description:
***NO PETS
Log cabin with gorgeous wood details w/ the “bear~essentials” 3 beds/1.5 baths. Upstairs is open loft area with king bed and full bathroom. Downstairs has 2 bedrooms, one with 2 twins and other with queen bed. Pull out couch in the living room with plenty of room for an air mattress. Outdoor grill and fire pit area. Ride your SxS/UTV to town & trailheads.

Cabin with loft bedroom and 2 other bedrooms with a pull out full size couch.

Access to whole cabin.

Town is a old coal mining town that allows riding SxS and UTV’s on public roads. Close to many trailheads.

Cabin is located in the ATV friendly town of Boissevain and 4 miles from Pocahontas (9 miles from the Town of Bluefield) with access to Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trail which connects to Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trails along with the Original Pocahontas Spearhead Trail.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #8 - The Colonel May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #8 - The Colonel May Room (Shared Bathroom)

The Colonel May room is dedicated to the youngest son of Andrew Jackson and Nelle May. Andrew named his son “Colonel” in hopes to pass along some of the luster and reputation of his own name. This room is fit for a Colonel and styled for one too. With all the furnishings being dark, rich mahogany, and walnut. A favorite talking piece of this room is the beautiful stone capped foot boards. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Cave- 2 Bedroom Cabin- Hatfield McCoy
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Plenty of parking
sectionedDescription/description:
The Cave is the perfect cabin for your family! It sleeps 4 but will accommodate up to 6 people. 2nd bedroom includes 12 inch pillow top Queen bed . (1) Three-quarter bathroom includes shower, sink, toilet and towel rack. Master bedroom has a 12 inch full size bed. (2) Master bathroom access from the master bedroom. All fresh linens, complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, bath towels and wash cloths and firewood for fire pit included. Privacy fence on premises.

Welcome to your home away from home! We’re committed to your comfort and adventure.

We are located with access to the Hatfield & McCoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. You can ride your ATV/SXS directly to the trails from our cabins! Whether you come to ride the trails, hiking, fishing, hunting or a romantic getaway; this is your home away from home!

The Cave cabin sleeps 4 but will accommodate up to 6 people. 2nd bedroom includes 12 inch pillow top Queen bed. (1) Three-quarter bathroom includes shower, sink, toilet and towel rack. Master bedroom has a 12 inch full size Gel-Infused green tea memory foam mattress with cooling gel foam bed. (2) Master bathroom access from the master bedroom with shower, toilet, sink and towel rack. There is room for an air mattress and / or sleeping bags in the living area. The couch has 2 recliners that lay all the way back to relax while watching movies. Living room with 42” Smart TV with Netflix, an eat-in full-size Kitchen with stove, sink, microwave, Keurig coffee maker and refrigerator. Heat/ A/C mini split unit, Free Wi-Fi. Fire pit, picnic table on large back porch and outdoor charcoal grills on premises.

All fresh linens, complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, bath towels and wash cloths, grilling utensils, kitchen cookware (larger cabin), toilet paper, paper towels, firewood for the firepit are all included at no additional cost. Our cabins and cottages can be rented as a group, family or vacation getaway!

Plenty of parking

We will be available to you if you need anything during your stay! We are only a phone call away!

We have plenty of parking. If you’re coming to ride the Hatfield & McCoy trails there is no need to trailer your SXS or UTV. You can ride directly to the trails from the cabin.

additionalHouseRules:
PLEASE HONOR 10AM CHECK-OUT
The cleaning attendant will arrive based on scheduled check-out time.

No smoking inside the cabin.  Cigarette butts must be disposed of in the bucket provided on the front porch.

Please be attentive to your pets and dispose of any waste from them in the immediate, non-wooded area of the yard to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not allow pets on the furniture to avoid a forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not leave pet unattended while you are away from the cabin.

Please clean up excess dog hair or accident they may have in the house to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please DO NOT park on the grass to avoid forfeit of deposit.

No parties or events; Guests should leave premises in neat and undamaged condition.

Please RETURN ANY MOVED INDOOR OR OUTDOOR FURNITURE to its original location to avoid forfeit of deposit.
 
Please strip the beds before your departure.

No unregistered guests allowed, please adhere to property’s stated capacity.
 
Please respect the local noise ordinance of quiet time after 10p.m.

Please do not use grill up next to or on the front porch of the cabins.

Please wash and put away dishes before checkout.

Please remove all food from the refrigerator and cabinets before checkout.

Please dispose of all trash and place in the outdoor bins beside garage. 

Please report any damages and/or breakages in a reasonably timely manner.

name: Romantic Getaway on Little Creek
photos/1/caption: Studio style cottage with lots of attention to detail.
photos/2/caption: Beautiful view of cascades in a park-like setting at your doorstep.
photos/4/caption: You can enjoy a view of the creek from the dining table.
photos/6/caption: Kitchenette comes with electric skillet, crockpot, microwave, toaster oven, wok, toaster,  two-burner portable stovetop and gas grill outdoors.
photos/7/caption: View of the creek from the front porch.
photos/11/caption: Cottage is located on a quiet country road.
photos/12/caption: View of the creek from the studio's bedroom window.
photos/14/caption: This is the back view of the cottage on the left that shows the proximity to the neighboring lodge.
photos/15/caption: This sign points the way to the cottage right passed the lodge driveway.
photos/16/caption: This shows the proximity to the neighboring lodge that is also for rent on Airbnb and the fire pit for The Cottage on Little Creek.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Cottage on Little Creek is a romantic creekside retreat nestled on a quiet country road. This 53-acre property borders the Jefferson National Forest with private trails in a park like setting with small waterfalls throughout the property. An unparalleled place to relax from the daily grind but only a short, 15-minute drive to Wytheville, VA.

We are pet friendly with lots of room for you four-legged love ones to explore.
We charge a pet fee of $25 for the first pet per stay and $10 for each additional pet per stay. 
The pet fee is collected separately through AirBNB after the cabin is booked.

***Please read below***
Water:  We are in a beautiful, rural location with well water; it has a sulphur smell to it.  Although, completely safe to drink and bathe in it has a strong smell many people are not accustomed to this so I like to let guests know upfront.  I leave a gallon of water in the cabin along with the breakfast basket but I always suggest guests bring plenty of water to cook with.

Wi-Fi: As mentioned above, this is a rural location which is great to decompress and find peace and quiet but high speed internet isn’t available in this area. We provide satellite internet, so guests can use Wi-Fi texting and calling (dependent on your cell provider- cell phone service is very limited), check emails and surf the web but streaming Netflix and downloading music unfortunately don’t work.  We have the highest amount of gigabytes available with HughesNet Satellite but once the data caps are reached(which is easy to do if streaming is tried and continues to buffer) the internet eventually stops.  We ask you to please be conscientious with the internet usage so all our guests are able to use it throughout their stay with us.

This place is so special and we want our guests to love it as much as we do so if there is anything we can do throughout your stay we are happy to help.

We are in a rural location; cell phone service is limited but we do have Hughesnet Satellite wi-fi, it doesn't stream video but allows for surfing the web, answering emails, wi-fi texting and calling(depending on you cell phone carrier plan).

As like many people in rural America we are on a well water system so the water has Sulphur, which is completely safe to drink and bath in but does have a Sulphur smell and is an acquired taste.  We supply a gallon of water but suggest our guests bring extra water for drinking due to the taste.

name: Seven Springs Mountain Cabin
primaryHost/about: We have 5 young children, love to travel and spend time with one another.  The most important things in our lives are God and family.
sectionedDescription/access: All parts of the property
sectionedDescription/description:
Beautiful, rustic cabin on a 3 acre recently-stocked pond.  Secluded on 50 acres of private property. Tranquil environment to relax and enjoy the abundant wildlife.   Sit in front of the 100 year-old (gas) fireplace, or enjoy the outdoor fire pit.  Hike on private Virginia Highland trails.  11 miles south of HWY 81. Conveniently located to New River Trail, Iron Heart Winery,   Cheateau Morrisette Winery, 35 miles to Radford University, 54 miles to Virginia Tech. The perfect getaway!

There are 50 acres with trails to roam and explore

All parts of the property

We are always available by phone or text, but will give you your space while staying at the property

sectionedDescription/summary: Beautiful, rustic cabin on a 3 acre recently-stocked pond.  Secluded on 50 acres of private property. Tranquil environment to relax and enjoy the abundant wildlife.   Sit in front of the 100 year-old (gas) fireplace, or enjoy the outdoor fire pit.  Hike on private Virginia Highland trails.  11 miles south of HWY 81. Conveniently located to New River Trail, Iron Heart Winery,   Cheateau Morrisette Winery, 35 miles to Radford University, 54 miles to Virginia Tech. The perfect getaway!

name: Wilderness Lodge w/ Hot Tub @ Four Fillies Lodge
photos/16/caption: Our creek, which sits about 1/8 miles away from the Hunting Cabin, contains small mouth bass and trout.
sectionedDescription/description:
Four Fillies Lodge is an 80 acre private estate available for you to explore & enjoy with your family. Our 140 year old reclaimed Wilderness Lodge is a rustic, antique cabin with modern amenities. This is the perfect place to enjoy relaxation or adventurous activities such as fishing, hiking, caving, white water rafting, and so much more! (6 additional cabins are available at FFL through Airbnb)

Follow us on social media @fourfillieslodgewv

Our Wilderness Lodge is an antique log cabin with an elegant rustic and romantic feel that is  tastefully decorated. It is known for its designer touches and comfort, making for the perfect getaway for you and your family!

Open floor plan (studio style) with a comfortable queen sized bed in the open space, open loft (accessed by a wide ladder) with 2 twin sized beds, 1 full bathroom with heated floors (stocked with towels, washcloths, and toiletpaper), a kitchenette with a small refrigerator, range, sink, and microwave (dishware, glasses, silverware, cooking ware, toaster, microwave, and a Keurig with a handful of K-Cups included).  Our dining table has seating for up to 4 people. There is a picnic table located right outside the cabin for outdoor dining. This cabin features a wood burning fireplace to keep you warm during our winter months (firewood not included but available for purchase). A TV with a DVD and BlueRay player only are included in the cabin. Wifi included inside cabin.

After a day of hiking, fishing, and adventures around the estate and surounding areas, your family can relax and unwind  while enjoying a meal cooked on the parkstyle charcoal grill (charcoal not provided).

-Daily housekeeping not included--cabin is cleaned between each guest check-in


***Featured on DIY's Barnwood Builders TV show

EXTRA ADD-ONS AVAILABLE (Please email to add on)

-Fishing day pass: $25/person plus tax (fish our stocked creek)
-Romance Package (Half dozen roses in a vase, silk rose petals on floor and bed, Charcuterie Box, Dessert Box, Battery operated candles around room) : $150 plus tax
-Charcuterie Box for Two: $35 plus tax
-Gourmet S'mores Box: $25 plus tax
-60 minute In-House Massage (subject to availability): $120 single/$225 couple's massage (massages take place on at a time, back to back)
-Firewood: $5/bundle plus tax
-Half dozen roses: $39 plus tax
-Half dozen cake pops (variety pack): $17 plus tax
-Four Fillies Lodge Logo mug (please let us know if you want us to send you a photo): $24 plus tax

We have a caretaker who lives of site nearby who can be contacted if you need anything your stay. For your convenience, the owner's phone number will be provided as well. Feel free to text/call this number during your stay if you need anything.

This charming and exclusive resort nestled on a beautiful winding creek provides a picturesque retreat for families and couples who desire to connect with nature amidst a landscape of impeccable rustic elegance and comfort.
We are  private 80 acre estate located at the dead end of Clyde Rule Street. Enter through our gate and into a peaceful, tranquil, forested oasis. Four Fillies Lodge is located just the limits of small town, Peterstown, West Virginia.

-Experiences around Four Fillies Lodge:We are  private 80 acre estate located at the dead end of Clyde Rule Street. Enter through our gate and into a peaceful, tranquil, forested.....Four Fillies Lodge is located just at the edge of town, Four Fillies Lodge is the small town of Peterstown.

Experiences around Four Fillies Lodge:
-Things to do:
-Fishing
-Hiking
-Mountain biking
-ATVing
-Hunting
-Winterplace Ski Resort about 40 min away
-Visit the Greenbrier--several nice restaurants, golf, spa, and winter activities
-Salt Cave and Spa 
-Lost World Caverns
-Organ Cave 
-Cascade Falls 
-River Expeditions (for outdoor adventures)
-Hatfield and McCoy Trails
-Tangent Outfitters

name: Relaxation near the Edge of the Woods
photos/8/caption: Driveway entrance to Back of house
primaryHost/about:
This is the home we grew up in a small town in southern WV with our parents and grandparents living across the road.  Our family wants to keep our childhood home that holds many memories of grandparents, friends, family, and neighbors as well as our children who grew to love the area.  That was the deciding decision for hosting the airbnb with brothers - Jamie and Troy with help from everyone else.

I am a retired art teacher from Taylor County WV and Lexington Senior High NC. I live in Thomasville NC with my husband who is also from McDowell County WV.  Besides art, I sew and have an online etsy shop.  My brother Troy, has a house-painting business and lives near Bluefield Va.  Our sister Ann, retired from teaching music and her husband have lived in many areas; they are now retired living in White Sulphur Springs WV.  Jamie, my youngest sibling, is a visual artist and works with Urban Tree in Pittsburgh Pa (unique wood furniture).
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music
sectionedDescription/description:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie

- very private location, woods are out back
- main entrance is to the right of the home; code will be sent for the lockbox - we always used the kitchen entrance
- all-purpose room (unheated) has a large table, lots of windows, and is great for crafting, art projects,  games, etc
- Artists/Photographers -lots of nature for inspiration -  the all-purpose room is surrounded by windows and has a large table for a workspace
- Writers - quiet and private
- large outdoor area with basketball hoop, a pond near the fire pit - pond has been low this year;  plenty of wood down - bring your axe if you want to chop more
- 2 carports -  at the lower parking and in back of the house; 
- Fully equipped kitchen, coffee bar set up on buffet - stocked coffee, filters, and tea bags - keurig is available so bring your favorite flavors
- kitchen towels, detergents will be provided 
- bath has soaps, body wash, hand sanitizers, first aid supplies
- two bedrooms specifically, third bedroom was the den that has a daybed and floor space to set up an air mattress, could also be used as a playroom or an office space; there is one locked room for owner storage
- bring sheets, wash cloths, and bath towels
- plenty of bed pillows to choose from; blankets available for use yet you may choose to bring your own bedding
- 'alexa' echo dot in kitchen, lamp on the dresser in the first bedroom is plugged into a smart plug, identified as smart plug 2, should we forget to deactivate while you're there
-Security cameras recently installed (Feb 2023) - we will deactivate while you are a guest 
- large yard and lot;  beautiful daylilies lined the driveway, the white azalea was in full-bloom this spring as well as the irises
- well-water - water softener is used, filter is on the kitchen faucet and a filtered pitcher if you want double-filtered water
-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.

If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music

There is a local contact name (Cindy) on the buffet should guests need anything immediately or call me and I will contact her.

Private setting with the woods behind you and beside you.  Pond on the lower lot with the fire pit.  One neighbor across the street.

The Warrior Trail is 10 miles from our house, parking is at the Trailhead office through the town of War (about another mile from the trail entrance.  The outlaw trails do not show up on the trail maps, we drew one to leave at the house for New Haven Road (hopefully the last riders left it). The other access is below Cucumber and called Big Creek Mountain Road. New Haven Rd is around 4 miles from our lodge, maybe 1/4 from the store and Big Creek Mountain Rd is another couple miles.  I've been told this is the map that will show you all trails...search bob t maps

Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

---Guests will be provided blankets/quilts, pillows, and kitchen towels.  Guests will provide their own sheets and bath towels.  Dish detergent, hand soaps, paper towels, bathroom tissue, and hand sanitizer are provided.
---its actually a 3BR home but one is presently locked for family storage and the den has an accordion door to give privacy as a 3rd bedroom
---Plenty of downed wood to be found for the firepit, might want to bring an ax or saw
---Hunters - if you’re coming during hunting seasons - there are 2 gun racks on the walls for your convenience
---Den area:  - there’s a daybed that sleeps one, a monitor that could be used with your device; there’s a few books and games
---The sofas both have pull-out beds, the love seat is more comfortable than the full but kids don't seem to notice.  The queen air mattress does fit in the den floor on the desk side
---Great views for artists and the all-purpose room would be a great place for painting - lots of windows
---Writers would enjoy the pace and quiet

sectionedDescription/notes:
---Guests will be provided blankets/quilts, pillows, and kitchen towels.  Guests will provide their own sheets and bath towels.  Dish detergent, hand soaps, paper towels, bathroom tissue, and hand sanitizer are provided.
---its actually a 3BR home but one is presently locked for family storage and the den has an accordion door to give privacy as a 3rd bedroom
---Plenty of downed wood to be found for the firepit, might want to bring an ax or saw
---Hunters - if you’re coming during hunting seasons - there are 2 gun racks on the walls for your convenience
---Den area:  - there’s a daybed that sleeps one, a monitor that could be used with your device; there’s a few books and games
---The sofas both have pull-out beds, the love seat is more comfortable than the full but kids don't seem to notice.  The queen air mattress does fit in the den floor on the desk side
---Great views for artists and the all-purpose room would be a great place for painting - lots of windows
---Writers would enjoy the pace and quiet
sectionedDescription/space:
- very private location, woods are out back
- main entrance is to the right of the home; code will be sent for the lockbox - we always used the kitchen entrance
- all-purpose room (unheated) has a large table, lots of windows, and is great for crafting, art projects,  games, etc
- Artists/Photographers -lots of nature for inspiration -  the all-purpose room is surrounded by windows and has a large table for a workspace
- Writers - quiet and private
- large outdoor area with basketball hoop, a pond near the fire pit - pond has been low this year;  plenty of wood down - bring your axe if you want to chop more
- 2 carports -  at the lower parking and in back of the house; 
- Fully equipped kitchen, coffee bar set up on buffet - stocked coffee, filters, and tea bags - keurig is available so bring your favorite flavors
- kitchen towels, detergents will be provided 
- bath has soaps, body wash, hand sanitizers, first aid supplies
- two bedrooms specifically, third bedroom was the den that has a daybed and floor space to set up an air mattress, could also be used as a playroom or an office space; there is one locked room for owner storage
- bring sheets, wash cloths, and bath towels
- plenty of bed pillows to choose from; blankets available for use yet you may choose to bring your own bedding
- 'alexa' echo dot in kitchen, lamp on the dresser in the first bedroom is plugged into a smart plug, identified as smart plug 2, should we forget to deactivate while you're there
-Security cameras recently installed (Feb 2023) - we will deactivate while you are a guest 
- large yard and lot;  beautiful daylilies lined the driveway, the white azalea was in full-bloom this spring as well as the irises
- well-water - water softener is used, filter is on the kitchen faucet and a filtered pitcher if you want double-filtered water
-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.
sectionedDescription/summary:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie
sectionedDescription/transit:
Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

additionalHouseRules:
House Rules 
 
Our aim is to ensure that you have an enjoyable time and as comfortable a stay as you possibly can. We have found it helps both us and our guests when we thoroughly communicate our expectations and house rules. I know, I know, rules are boring…but these rules ensure we can provide future guests with a great experience as well. 

Parking is free and conveniently available in the driveway to the right of the house. It will accommodate 2-3 cars easily. This driveway leads to a garage behind the house that we use for projects. We try to limit our use of the garage during guest stays, but we will let you know in advance if we need to get in and out of the driveway. However, this is the exception rather than the norm, so please use the driveway freely.  

We have made the decision to open up the basement in order for our guests to have the convenience of using the washer/dryer. Please understand that this is still a rough unfinished space. We are working on some remodeling projects to make it a nicer area for laundry. However, we ask that guests stay out of the basement unless they have specific need of the space, for laundering or other approved use by the hosts. It is also preferred that guests keep the accordion door at the top of the steps closed and use the front door as much as possible. The side exterior door is a snug fit and you may find it difficult to open and close fully without extra effort, please insure it’s securely closed when you leave the property and at night if you have used it during your stay. 
 
No Parties or Events. We do allow daytime visitors, but ask that you stay within a reasonable number of people for the space. Otherwise, only the number of adults listed in the reservation are to be at the house. If you have more overnight guests than what are registered the booking guest will receive a reservation change with additional charges of $50 per person, per night (If you register them the cost is only $25 per guest per night). If we discover that the number of overnight guests exceeds the 6-adult maximum we will contact you to resolve the issue as promptly as possible. Satisfactory resolution is at our discretion. We do use a security system with exterior cameras to verify the number of overnight guests and if animals are present in the house. 
 
Dogs are allowed, based on our approval of size/breed. It is assumed that dogs are housebroken. There is a pet fee, and dogs must be paid for and approved prior to guest arrival. We prefer the dog(s) to be crated any time they are left at the house alone. NO CATS OR OTHER PETS ALLOWED. One of your hosts has a history of severe allergic reactions to cats, therefore if any pets (other than approved dogs) are discovered in the house we reserve the right to evict immediately without a refund. 
 
No Smoking Allowed. Any evidence of smoking in the house will result in a $200 fee. Smoking in outdoor areas is okay as long as butts are discarded properly. 
 
If your shoes are wet or dirty, please remove them before entering. You can leave them on the porch or use the boot tray by the door. This house is located in a residential neighborhood and although the houses are generously spaced, we ask that you be considerate of our neighbors with your noise level. Please follow any instructions, label notes or manuals we have left in order to ensure longevity of furnishings, appliances and other items. Read through the checkout procedures to familiarize yourself with what we expect of our guests. 

Checkout time is 11AM. If you find that you need a late check-out, please know that we will try to accommodate requests if there is not a same day check-in. There is a late check out fee of $10/hour, when needed and if available. 

Check under beds for misplaced belongings, check outlets for chargers that belong to you and remember to log out of any accounts you used on the Xbox, Living Room TV streaming service or the upstairs Roku. 

Close all windows securely. Turn off all the lights, and allow the thermostat to return to its regular schedule. 

Please remove sheets and pillowcases off of any bed used and leave the linens by the door of the bedroom, please leave mattress pads on the bed and place comforter and all pillows back on the bed. Place all used towels in the bath tub. 

Please wash any used dishes, if you need to leave any in the drying rack, we will gladly put them away. 

When you leave through the front door, lock both exterior doors from the inside and leave the keys on the table. 

Please take a moment to write a note in our guest book. If you enjoyed your stay, please leave us a review. If there were any problems, or you have any suggestions, send us a message through Airbnb or email us directly and let us know how we can improve. 

Thanks, 
David & Christy

primaryHost/about: My husband, David and I have traveled and stayed in Airbnbs for several years now. So when we finished remodeling a house we had purchased it was a dream come true to be able to make it into our own hosting experience. We are pastors in Pearisburg, Va and have three children, two adult sons and a teenage daughter.
sectionedDescription/access:
We are located in a private neighborhood tucked away above the local high school. Convenient to route 460 with two gas stations and a Dollar General less than one mile away. Just across the bridge is the quaint ‘downtown’ of Narrows where you can find a weekly seasonal farmers market and local Grants grocery store. For a peaceful walk, or a moment of quiet stillness visit the duck pond. For a little more excitement, on the weekend head to the “stock market” a weekly cattle auction. Contact the various local towns visitors centers for more info on the Appalachian Trail Heads, New River accesses, available hunting expeditions, hiking trails including Cascade Falls in Pembroke, Va and the many trails around the nearby famous Mountain Lake Resort. If you like a taste of the adventure of outdoor play visit the Kairos Wilderness Resort during your trip. Check out our guidebook or feel free to reach out to us for any other information you may need on the various other attractions of our area. 
Head into Pearisburg, Va the Giles County seat just minutes down 460, home to a couple small shopping centers with larger grocery stores and many small town shops. 
If you are in town to visit one of the local college campuses head northwest for Concord College (36 Minutes, 29 Miles), east to visit Virginia Tech (32 Minutes, 28 Miles), southeast for Radford University (47 Minutes, 34 Miles) or New River Community College (32 Minutes, 25 Miles).
sectionedDescription/description:
Forget your worries in this spacious and serene spot minutes from the West Virginia border. Mountain views surround this 3 bedroom home located in Narrows, Va, a community that brims with small town charm. Less than 30 miles to Virginia Tech, Concord College, or Radford University. Winterplace, Mountain Lake and Kairos Wilderness are just a short drive away too. Giles Co. is home to 37 miles of the New River, with endless hiking including the Appalachian Trail, and the must see Cascade Falls.

Enter our open concept home and enjoy the streaming service of your choice on the 50” tv while making a meal for your friends or family in the open kitchen. First two bedrooms are on the main floor. One has a full size bed, and the second has a queen size bedroom suit with a dresser and chest of drawers. Between the bedrooms and through an easily gliding barn door find the bathroom that is just the right size for “one at a time” use with a vanity and tub/shower combo. In other words, it’s small, but adequate to serve our guests. Although, you may find scheduling showers helpful if you are at the upper end of our guest limit with 5 or 6 adults. Just upstairs you will find a beautiful sitting room with an elevated view of the mountains that includes a desk/office space for the business traveler. Then further on through another door is the final bedroom with a spacious king bed that can easily be separated into two twin beds by the hosts upon request at booking. This space enjoys its own A/C and Heating Unit that can be controlled separately from the lower levels. Enjoy watching television on the 42” tv in this bedroom equipped with a Roku. 
The unfinished basement holds a washer and dryer and has ample space for sorting laundry.

We are located in a private neighborhood tucked away above the local high school. Convenient to route 460 with two gas stations and a Dollar General less than one mile away. Just across the bridge is the quaint ‘downtown’ of Narrows where you can find a weekly seasonal farmers market and local Grants grocery store. For a peaceful walk, or a moment of quiet stillness visit the duck pond. For a little more excitement, on the weekend head to the “stock market” a weekly cattle auction. Contact the various local towns visitors centers for more info on the Appalachian Trail Heads, New River accesses, available hunting expeditions, hiking trails including Cascade Falls in Pembroke, Va and the many trails around the nearby famous Mountain Lake Resort. If you like a taste of the adventure of outdoor play visit the Kairos Wilderness Resort during your trip. Check out our guidebook or feel free to reach out to us for any other information you may need on the various other attractions of our area. 
Head into Pearisburg, Va the Giles County seat just minutes down 460, home to a couple small shopping centers with larger grocery stores and many small town shops. 
If you are in town to visit one of the local college campuses head northwest for Concord College (36 Minutes, 29 Miles), east to visit Virginia Tech (32 Minutes, 28 Miles), southeast for Radford University (47 Minutes, 34 Miles) or New River Community College (32 Minutes, 25 Miles).

Your hosts live just ten minutes away and are readily available to help or answer questions you may have. We have a personal garage on this property so you will likely see us come in or out but our access to the house will be limited to attending to the needs of our guests. You are welcome to drop in the garage and say hi if we are there as we will surely be working on our latest project. We will do our best to respect the privacy of our guests in our coming and going. You can call or text our phone during your stay if needed or contact us through the app or email.

We are in a neighborhood with neighbors in close proximity to the house. Please respect their privacy and know that yours will be respected in return. We have always found our neighbors to be helpful and kind.

Convenient to 460, less than a mile from the light in Narrows.

Before and during your stay you can  check out “Christy’s” guidebook here in the airBNB app for some nearby highlights. During your stay there are pamphlets for local attractions in the drawer under the microwave.
There is a picnic basket provided for your use during your stay…mainly because we are just romantics at heart. 
Hangers are available for your use in every closet. 
The iron and ironing board are located in the left side bedroom closet; along with extra pillows. In the right side bedroom, the labeled dresser drawers have the hair dryer and extra blankets. In the same bedroom, but in the chest of drawers you will find all provided guest towels, wash clothes and as a bonus complimentary pairs of slippers for you to use during your stay and to take home when you leave.  
There is an Xbox connected to the living room television but you will need to have your own Microsoft account or games of your own to use it. There is high speed internet service which you will use to view shows and movies via the provided streaming service on the Living Room TV and a Roku upstairs. HBO Max will be logged in for you upon arrival.
The coffee table lifts to table height for use as extra dining space. Please use two hands to lift both sides evenly and simultaneously. You shouldn’t have to force the lift or on closure; it should glide easily. 
Please protect the living room furniture with coasters, tablecloth, and placemats as necessary.
Please see our house manual from more detailed instructions and listings of what we offer throughout the house.

sectionedDescription/description:
A comfortable, large private suite in our home, that includes your own kitchenette, stocked with cold water and tea, private .5 bath in the suite and a private full bath on the second floor, HDTV and free WiFi. Located in a quiet neighborhood in Beckley, West Virginia. (50 min south of Charleston, WV, 4.5hrs from Washington DC, ). Snacks & coffee available.

 We look forward to seeing you!

There are two queen beds and couch in the room.

Our guests may enjoy their suite, the patios, the kitchen and the upstairs full bathroom.

I like to leave our guests to themselves to decompress from their journey and get some rest, but I will be around for any comments or to answer any questions you may have.

Someone is usually around the house, but if we are not home, then just text me.  -Sheila

name: The Dragon's Den - Upstairs Private Room 2
primaryHost/about: I am a motor head for as long as I can remember and enjoy spending time in Tazewell so much I decided to build my own AirBnB and share my passion with others.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to their assigned room, the bathroom on that floor and all public spaces in the house.
sectionedDescription/description:
Minutes from downtown shopping and dining and easy access to the infamous Back of the Dragon. Only one hour to Winterplace Ski Resort.  Also an hour drive to the famous Hatfield McCoy trails!Each room has a private programmable lock. Each room will have towels, shampoo and soap for two. Newly paved driveway with room for cars and bikes

Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

cozy 2nd floor room with closet. Queen size bed, 40" smart TV, nightstand and dresser. access to shared kitchen, living and bathrooms. Relax on one of the two porches and enjoy the mountain views. Deer roaming is a regular occurrence as well!

Guests have access to their assigned room, the bathroom on that floor and all public spaces in the house.

I am available 24/7 by phone if anything is needed. I am also available for recommendations on request.

Tazewell is known for a lot of things but public transportation may not be one of them. Everything you need is less than 10 minutes drive away including shopping, dining and activities.

cameras monitor the driveway and front porch.

name: Perfectly located two bedroom duplex in Welch WV
primaryHost/about: My wife Elise and I have lived in McDowell County since November 2015. We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/description:
This home is located within walking distances of downtown Welch and the Welch Community Hospital.

Our home has two units, the one that you will be staying in is our downstairs unit.  The upstairs unit has a separate entrance by an outside staircase.  Our downstairs unit has two bedrooms, one bathroom and a spacious great room that combines the kitchen, dinning room and living room.

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Rest and relaxation are what you can expect when you stay at this welcoming 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental home in Wytheville. The house boasts a large deck where you can soak up the sun, a fully equipped kitchen to cook family meals, a hot tub, patio, firepit, and a cozy fireplace where you can sit and read or share stories. There’s no shortage of recreation in this area - spend all day exploring the New River Trail State Park, Stone Mountain State Park, or the Pilot Mountain State Park.

3/4 Acres | Across from Big Survey Forest | Private Hot Tub

Nature lovers, homebodies, and adventure seekers are welcome at this inviting abode featuring comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces, and a quiet location. 

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Twin/Full Bunk Bed

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TV, bathtub, gas fireplace, expansive windows, natural lighting
OUTDOOR LIVING: Expansive deck, patio, gas grill, outdoor dining area, fire pit, hammock, private yard 
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, stainless steel appliances, blender, coffee maker, cooking basics, spices
GENERAL: Free WiFi, linens/towels, air conditioning, books, central heating, washer/dryer, laundry detergent, adjustable base bed, smoke detectors, fire hydrant
FAQ: Access only by stairs (single-story home inside, exterior steps only)
PARKING: Driveway (4 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OUTDOOR RECREATION: Crystal Springs Recreation area (3.4 miles), New River Trail State Park (19.4 miles), Hale Lake (21.3 miles), Comers Rock (23.7 miles), Dicky's Knob Trail (29.6 miles), Hungry Mother State Park (30.8 miles), Devils Nature Preserve (37.9 miles), Salt Trail (48.5 miles), Rowland Creek Falls (50.6 miles), Stone Mountain State Park (55.3 miles), Appalachian Trail at Mount Rogers (58.5 miles), Pilot Mountain State Park (69.7 miles)
THINGS TO DO: Fort Chiswell Animal Park (11.8 miles), The Blue Ridge Mountain Center (31.9 miles), Old Cranks Museum (36.6 miles), Jeff Matthews Museum (37.3 miles), High Country Lights (37.5 miles), Andy Griffith Museum (50.5 miles)
EAT + DRINK: 7 Dogs Brew Pub (2.1 miles), Graze on Main (2.3 miles), Chaus Corner Bakery (2.3 miles), Moon Dog Brick Oven (2.3 miles), Seven Sisters Brewery (2.4 miles), Log House 1776 Restaurant (2.5 miles), Peking Chinese Restaurant (3.3 miles), CJ’s Pizza (3.5 miles), Grayson Restaurant (3.9 miles), The Dutch Pantry (13.1 miles), Country Chicken (14.3 miles)
AIRPORT: Charlotte Douglas International Airport (144 miles)

name: Warrior trail: Love Shack Caretta 879 ATV lodging
primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!

sectionedDescription/access: All access to the house
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom 1 bath creekside house located 7 minutes from War, WV. Just off Warrior trail#16. 
Surrounded by mountains and Outlaw Trails. Cozy dine in kitchen, comfortable living room with smart tv and wifi.
plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Creekside firepit and charcoal grill for outdoor entertaining.

All access to the house

Feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns, or if you just want advice on some of the Outlaw Trails.

This house is located just minutes from access to Warrior Trail # 16, from the town of  War for restaurants, gas and groceries, and from Berwind Lake for scenic route and relaxation.

There is parking available on both sides and in front of this house for trucks and trailers. You can ride your ATVs almost anywhere you want to go from this house.

Local grocery store and restaurants are only 7 minutes away. Most close by around 8 pm if not earlier. The gas station remains open until around 11 pm.

name: Red Dirt ATV Resort
sectionedDescription/access: You and your guests will have full access to the entire property including the pool, the kids play area and the additional lot for parking.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 3 bed 2 bath home sits right in the heart of atv country. You will have access to the Spearhead trails of Va and the Hatfield and Mccoy trails in Wv. After a long day of riding you can come back and relax by the pool or hang out inside with cable tv and WiFi. This home can easily house 10 people with room to spare. We also have a children’s play area and lots of parking 2 1/2 acres attached so you will have plenty of room for your trailers.  $500 Refundable Damage deposit required.

Along with having three trails systems to choose from, you will have full access to our pool area that includes outside seating and a grill.

You and your guests will have full access to the entire property including the pool, the kids play area and the additional lot for parking.

We want to thank you for staying with us.  Message us and we will answer you as quickly as possible.

Spearhead Trails, Hatfield McCoy Trails and the Pocahontas Trail Head

Parking available at the house and additional parking above the house. There is a sharp turn on Dunn rd. Largest truck and trailer up hill is 24’ enclosed behind a long bed dually.

name: The Dragon's Den - Upstairs Private Room 3
photos/14/caption: Rent me on Riders Share. No motorcycle license required!
primaryHost/about: I am a motor head for as long as I can remember and enjoy spending time in Tazewell so much I decided to build my own AirBnB and share my passion with others.
sectionedDescription/access:
Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

Guests will have access to all shared spaces in the house including kitchen, dining and living rooms along with outdoor spaces.
sectionedDescription/description:
Minutes from downtown shopping and dining and easy access to the infamous Back of the Dragon. One hour to Winterplace Ski Resort, WV. Also one hour to the famous Hatfield McCoy trails.. High speed wireless internet throughout the entire property. 40" HD Smart TV in every room.

This is a second floor bedroom with access to the kitchen, bathroom and patio. Room has a 40" HD smart TV and WiFi enabling you to use your favorite streaming app. Enjoy the entire home including kitchen, 2 bathrooms and front and back porches.

Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

Guests will have access to all shared spaces in the house including kitchen, dining and living rooms along with outdoor spaces.

Either myself or someone that works with me will be available 24/7 during your stay making sure it is comfortable and relaxing.

Come explore historic downtown Tazewell, VA and everything it has to offer. Walking distance to breweries and restaurants, Tazewell is a beautiful place to relax and call home for the weekend.

Not much public transportation so a car/motorcycle is required.

The house is on a septic system.  Only the provided toilet paper can be flushed.  All other items need to be disposed of in provided bins.  There will be an additional fee of $25 for use of the airbed or pull out couch.

cameras monitor the driveway and front porch.

name: Bear Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails
sectionedDescription/description:
Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages are non-smoking, sleep up to 4 people and provide all the comforts of home. We are located near the Hatfield & McCoy trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. Cottages and cabins include Heat / AC mini splits, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, refrigerator, three-quarter bath, 32” TV with Netflix/Directv, fresh linens, bath towels & housekeeping service. Outdoor fire pit and charcoal grill. Privacy fence on the premises.

Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, charcoal grill and pinic table. There is also a second rental available,  " Papa's Den-Hatifield & McCoy Trails", on Airbnb as well that sleeps 3 people. These cabins are located on the same property. There is plenty of parking for trailers and ATVs / SXS and easy access to Hatfield and Mccoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails.

Drive directly to the Hatifield and McCoy trailheads on your SXS. 
Large Parking lot at the cabins.

We pride ourselves on your fun and crazy adventure while staying at Trail Bandits Cabins. Please help us keep it just as fun for our community and our fellow campers. Please read over our rental terms and conditions.

As always, remember to UNLEASH YOUR ADVENTURE!

Our Policy

Cabin rental incidental deposits are non-refundable if your reservation is cancelled with less than 30 days remaining before your arrival date.  Deposits for holiday/holiday weekends are not refundable under any conditions if cancelled.

Reschedule requests will be only be accepted if there are 30 days or longer remaining before your scheduled arrival date.  These requests are subject to availability. * Inclement weather cancellations will not be accepted.

Failure to adhere to your reservation with no communication will forfeit your deposit and you will be charged the remaining balance of your stay.

Cabin Terms and Conditions

Check-in time is 3pm on your arrival date, and check out time is 11am on your departure date. 

Guests will be charged a one time $50 cleaning fee at the time of reservation.

Cabins are non-smoking.  Guests will be charged a one time $250 cleaning fee if smoking is detected inside the cabins and you will forfeit your deposit.

The maximum capacity per standard cabin is 3 adults.  The maximum capacity for our larger cabin is 4 adults.   Violators will be evicted, and no refund will be issued.  Small children will be exempt from this rule. 

Playing on loft ladders is prohibited. Face the ladder when going up or down. Do not carry objects in your hands while on the ladder.

Park ONLY in the designated parking areas which is in front of your cabin or across the road in the grass area.  

Alcohol is permitted.  Disorderly conduct is not allowed.

*No atv or any off road vehicles are allowed in any of the rivers.

Please honor the posted speed limit in our atv community.  

The reserving guests will be responsible for any damages to your cabin or premises. 

Please do not place, burn or leave trash in your fire pit. Outside charcoal grills need to be cleaned prior to the departure of your stay.

We ask that all guest respect your fellow campers and community. 

Quiet the noise after 10:00pm for respect of the community and other campers.

No excessive riding in the cabin areas or driveways.   No driving or parking your ATV on the grass where the charcoal grills and picnic tables are located.

There are outdoor surveillance cameras around the campground for the protection of your items.

Ready to Reserve!

You must reserve with an incidental deposit of $250. Incidental deposits are refundable upon checkout as long as there are no damages or additional charges made. If additional charges or damages occur during your stay, you will receive the incidental deposit back less the cost of damages or additional charges. Cabins cannot be reserved and will not be held without a deposit.

All rentals require a 2-night minimum.

Pet Friendly – We love Pets!

Trail Bandits Cabins offers pet friendly cabins. 

Pets that are non-aggressive are allowed with a $20 per pet surcharge per night.  No more than 1 pet is allowed per cabin unless approved by host for more.

All pets must be registered at check-in. If not registered and found on the premises, you will be evicted and deposit forfeited.

Excessive barking that is a disturbance to other campers will not be allowed.  

**Pets must be crated if left alone.

Pets should be on a leash at all times while outside. Please clean up any waste left by your pet.

Reserving guest is responsible for any damages caused by pets. If any damages occur, incidental deposit will be forfeited.

Pets must be 40 pounds or less due to insurance restrictions and campground policy procedures.
