primaryHost/about: I am a pharmacist from rural Appalachian Virginia. Married with 2 adult children with whom I enjoy traveling the world whenever possible.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom apartment in Cedar Bluff Virginia town limits. Sleeps 4-5. Friendly community. Tranquil setting in a rural town with a creek flowing nearby. 5 min to Richlands. 10 min from the local hospital, Clinch Valley Medical Center. 20 min to Tazewell. 15 min to the Dragon's Back. 75 min to Bristol Motor Speedway. Multiple 4-wheeler trails nearby. Local trout streams 30 minutes in any direction. Washer/Dryer access. Free coffee, and WiFi. Private 2nd-floor entrance via outdoor stairs.

Grocery stores and pharmacies are conveniently located only 6 minutes away. Only 1 mile from the Blue Tornadoes Football field. If you happen to be a football fan you can find the whole town at Richlands High School on Friday nights during the fall.

The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.

Available by phone. We live locally so are available in the event of an emergency.

Enjoy gorgeous foliage and a breathtaking view at Cedar Bluff Overlook. It is about a 30-minute hike on a marked trail. Enjoy scenic drives through the Clinch Mountains, East River Mountains, and the Appalachian Mountains all around the area.
The Cedar Bluff Heritage Festival occurs annually on the third Saturday of September. You will find antique dealers and food vendors among many other activities. The festival attracts thousands of visitors and hundreds of vendors each year.  OKTOBREWFEST is a festival that is held on beautiful historic Main St. Tazewell, VA the first Saturday of October and was created to promote the craft beer industry in southwest VA and the surrounding area. It is the Premier Craft Beer Festival of the Heart of Appalachia.  There are several local restaurants of note, Cuz’s restaurant has been named the best in off-the-beaten-track restaurant categories. Bearded Moose is a frequented local barbecue restaurant loved by locals, and you can enjoy a sweet treat at Sugarfoot Bakery only 6 minutes away. Painted Peak Brewing Company is approximately 25 minutes away from the apartment where you can sample local brews. Multiple hiking trails and 4 wheeler trails are options for your entertainment. Kayaking and canoeing are available at local lakes and rivers. Enjoy Crab Orchard Museum located about 15 minutes away to learn more about the history in our area.
The apartment is located approximately 30 min from the Appalachian College of Pharmacy and approximately 13 minutes from Southwest Community College. Raven Theater is a historic site located about 10 minutes away. Limited show-times and hours, but when they are open it is a special stop for soda fountain ice cream.  Broadway Cinemas is the local contemporary theater located about 6 minutes away.

The town of Cedar Bluff has sidewalks with lights and you can enjoy a leisurely afternoon stroll. 4 County Transit offers public transportation. Town route fare is 25¢ per boarding.
Work express fare is 50¢ per boarding.
College routes are public routes and open to anyone who wants to ride. Fare for public riders is $1.00 per boarding.
College route fare is FREE for college students and staff/faculty who present college ID, seniors at least 60 years old, and children 5 or younger who are accompanied by an adult.
At your request, the bus can stop at other locations that are along its route. This is a route deviation service. 
Please call at least 48 hours in advance with your requests. 
Check out their website for additional information.

name: The Whitetail at Pipestem Place
primaryHost/about:
A "should have been" West Virginian...my parents were both born and raised in the Hills of WV and with grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins mostly residing there for all of their lives, I spent most of my summers and any vacation time visiting and growing to love my “once removed” roots. Though I grew up in South Florida, I loved my summers there away from the Florida heat. I hiked in the woods, swam in cold streams, explored waterfalls and fell in love. Being adventurous, I rapelled in the New River Gorge, skiied for the first time at Snowshoe and learned a love of rafting that continues today as I pursue trips on many Western Rivers in New Mexico, Colorado, Utah and Arizona.Life took me out west to Santa Fe, New Mexico where I pursued an art career and eventually a Real Estate career. I feel blessed to have helped my mother find her dream cabins, and to now again get to spend family time in this wonderful place. Many friends and family are still nearby and it is like coming “home” to stay at the cabins on Anam Cara Way.

We hope you will find joy, and peace, and feel that our home is your home when you stay at our sweet cabins.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Whitetail is a conventional-style log cabin, cozy and appealing, with two bedrooms, two baths, living room, dining and kitchen; stone wood-burning fireplace, central A/C-heat. The Whitetail is reminiscent of the simple, tranquil country life as you swing or rock on the front porch, listen and watch for beautiful songbirds, deer and other wildlife that often wander across the meadow.   'Tis the peaceful life at Pipestem Place on Anam Cara Way!

The village of Pipestem and **Pipestem Resort State Park, one of WV's most outstanding parks, sit high on a plateau with deep canyons, converging rivers and streams, high rolling hills ~ a unique, diverse vacation land, a mecca for exploration, photography and recreation! Our two vacation log cabins, The Robin and The Whitetail are located in a natural, serene setting on Anam Cara Way in Pipestem, WV, only one-half mile from Pipestem Resort State Park.

We are available by phone, text or email at any time. Though we don't live nearby, we have a property manager available on short notice for any emergency.

Nearby Adventures :
Pipestem State Park has both an 18 hole and a 9 hole par 3 course, heated indoor and Olympic-size outdoor swimming pools, over 20 hiking trails, horseback riding, kyaking/boating/fishing, archery, camping, aerial tram, zip-line ((upcoming 2019), and many other recreational, educational and entertainment events and activities throughout the year.

White water rafting
There are several commercial wild water rafting companies, offering various levels of rafting. Most of our West Virginia whitewater rafting trips are a full-day adventure of approximately 6-8 hours - and include a specially-prepared riverside lunch and river equipment. No experience is necessary for any New River whitewater rafting trip. professional guides are in each raft.

Hiking
Hiking is great in the area, many trails to scenic waterfalls are nearby including Brush Creek Falls, Sandstone Falls and Pipestem State Park.

Winterplace in Beckley, WV has snow skiing in Winter and is also less than an hour away.
Bluestone Lake Recreational Area is about 9 miles down Hwy 20, and has swimming and boat rentals available in warmer seasons.

additionalHouseRules: Minimum two-night stay.  11 to 7 quiet time.  No shoes in the house.  Muddy clothing?  Enter through laundry room.  Narrow mountain road can not accommodate trailers more than 18 ft.  Plenty of parking once you get here.  Do not use towels to wipe down your equipment.  There are rags in the laundry room.  Park trailers in the pasture below the house.  Do not drive on the lawn.

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet mountain guest home on a private country road.  Relax on our huge front porch and watch the deer graze nearby.  Lots of wildlife to observe as you sip your morning.  Bring your kayak and launch on the Bluestone River just 2 miles away!  Visit nearby Pinnacle  Rock State Park. Winterplace ski resort is 45 minutes away as is Tamarack.  Visit America’s newest national park at New River Gorge National Park!   Ride to  Hatfield McCoy ATV trails from here.  Great place for families.

Enjoy a stroll back to Victorian times as your walk past coal baron mansions.  Take a peek inside the homes at the spring and Christmas tour of homes.  Our guest house offers the finer aspects of visiting the area with a cozy feel.  We are off the beaten path with no ATVs whizzing past your home.  Truly enjoy nature here!  Relax by the fire pit in the backyard with plenty of seating.  Ride your atvs to the trails from here!  Minimum two-night stay.

Owner on adjoining property.

Historic Bramwell boasts three eateries!  .Enjoy walking the brick streets and the millionaire mansions.
Go skiing at nearby Winterplace or visit Pipestem State Park.   Both are 45 minutes away!

Plenty of parking.  Only 3 miles to Bramwell.  Ride your ATVs to the trails 4 miles away!

Do not take Bell St.  It's a dead end.  Instead, proceed on Coopers St to Shinbrier Hill Rd.   Follow to Cliffview Rd
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Minimum two-night stay.  11 to 7 quiet time.  No shoes in the house.  Muddy clothing?  Enter through laundry room.  Narrow mountain road can not accommodate trailers more than 18 ft.  Plenty of parking once you get here.  Do not use towels to wipe down your equipment.  There are rags in the laundry room.  Park trailers in the pasture below the house.  Do not drive on the lawn.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Owner on adjoining property.
sectionedDescription/name: Shinbrier Cottages guest house lodging in Bramwell
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
Historic Bramwell boasts three eateries!  .Enjoy walking the brick streets and the millionaire mansions.
Go skiing at nearby Winterplace or visit Pipestem State Park.   Both are 45 minutes away!
sectionedDescription/notes: Do not take Bell St.  It's a dead end.  Instead, proceed on Coopers St to Shinbrier Hill Rd.   Follow to Cliffview Rd
sectionedDescription/space: Enjoy a stroll back to Victorian times as your walk past coal baron mansions.  Take a peek inside the homes at the spring and Christmas tour of homes.  Our guest house offers the finer aspects of visiting the area with a cozy feel.  We are off the beaten path with no ATVs whizzing past your home.  Truly enjoy nature here!  Relax by the fire pit in the backyard with plenty of seating.  Ride your atvs to the trails from here!  Minimum two-night stay.
sectionedDescription/summary: Quiet mountain guest home on a private country road.  Relax on our huge front porch and watch the deer graze nearby.  Lots of wildlife to observe as you sip your morning.  Bring your kayak and launch on the Bluestone River just 2 miles away!  Visit nearby Pinnacle  Rock State Park. Winterplace ski resort is 45 minutes away as is Tamarack.  Visit America’s newest national park at New River Gorge National Park!   Ride to  Hatfield McCoy ATV trails from here.  Great place for families.
sectionedDescription/transit: Plenty of parking.  Only 3 miles to Bramwell.  Ride your ATVs to the trails 4 miles away!

photos/3/caption:
Bedroom 1 
Spacious with queen bed and private balcony
photos/15/caption: Day bed is located in common area outside the three bedrooms and in passageway to other parts of the house.  Other guests will be in this area.
photos/38/caption: There is a day bed in the common area on the landing outside the three private bedrooms.
primaryHost/about: My husband is a retired German Language professor and I am still loving my work as a school psychologist.   We travel, read, and grow wonderful flowers in our little piece of the world.    When not on Tallery Mountain, we keep returning to Saint Malo, France.  We love the food, the sea and the history there almost as much as the food, the mountains and the history here.   We are West Virginians, born and raised.  Company is always welcome.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire cabin, yard and the surrounding woods are accessible.  Since we are located right between Bluestone and Pipestem state parks, wildlife abounds  !
sectionedDescription/description:
If you're looking for that out of the way place to just relax, it's here.  In twenty minutes you can be fishing Bluestone Lake or the Greenbrier River, taking in lunch or the neat shops in Hinton, or just enjoying Pipestem or Bluestone State Parks. Three bedrooms and two baths, the perfect getaway.  Watch the sun come up over the mountains or the meteor showers while stargazing.

At the end of the road in the woods, it has a big yard with fire pit. Yet, it’s only fifteen minutes to good restaurants and attractions 
It’s the perfect place to get away and still be close to so many good restaurants, outdoor activities and beautiful surroundings. If interested in stargazing, golfing, water sports, zip lining or fishing...you’re there! Also, let’s not forget that it is right in the middle of some of the best motorcycle roads anywhere.  Three bedrooms that sleep six with a day bed and couch for the extras, it’s spacious and furnished with everything you need except your food and clothing.  It has 2 baths.  Set in the woods on Pinnacle Ridge in True, WV (on the mountain above Bluestone Lake and Hinton, it’s right between Bluestone and Pipestem state parks in Summers County.  It sleeps 8 for $125 per night with a two night minimum stay.  Come join us on the mountain ...its worth it!
PS: Bring marshmallows for the campfire

name: Conveniently located Apartment - Pipestem /Concord
primaryHost/about:
Hello - I own and operate Prime Capital Properties, which offers homes and apartments near Concord University in Athens, West Virginia.  During the Summer, we have several empty apartments that we provide a safe place and a bed for a reasonable price, and you do the rest!  
Wherever you stay, we are just a few blocks away at any time.  I'm a world traveler myself and try to use my passport at least once a year!
sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the entire efficiency apartment.
sectionedDescription/description:
This small 340 Square Foot apartment will do great for your sleeping arrangements.  There's no TV, so get out and explore Wild and Wonderful West Virginia!  Located in Athens WV, Home of Concord University, and just a short drive to Pipestem, Bluestone lake, and historic Hinton WV.  One twin and one full bed are provided, both were changed in 2019.  CANNOT be occupied by more than 2 persons.  Remodeled 2010, new carpet 2018.  Features fridge, stove, microwave, full bathtub with shower.

Due to local regulations, this unit may not be occupied by more than 2 persons.  If you are coming for an event at the local university in Athens, walk out the back door to the adjoining university property.  This unit is located in an apartment building with 3 other occupied apartments with quiet people, and respect for our other guests is mandatory.  Short drive to Princeton, Pipestem and many other attractions.

You will have access to the entire efficiency apartment.

Please text me if you have any questions!

Feel free to walk around the neighborhood.  Adjacent to the US Post Office just a few minute walk, a small park contains a sign marking the "Athens Concord Trails", these include a mixture of on and off campus trails mapped out around the local area.  In town, we have CVS as our chain pharmacy, Dollar General as the local chain store, and Ginos as the chain restaurant.  Moe's is a local restaurant next door to the gas station with great reviews and a full menu of many types of food, and lots of comfort food options.

You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

sectionedDescription/description:
The cottage is located 16 mile from Pipestem State Park (hiking, fishing, horseback riding, ziplines, full 18 and 9 hole golf course and lots of other seasonal activities). We are 18 miles to Winterplace Ski Resort and 27 miles from the historic railroad town of Hinton WV. There are beautiful waterfalls nearby at Camp Creek located 10 miles and Brush Creek Falls 8 miles from the cabin! Whether its for a vacation, special occasion, honeymoon, or quick getaway you are sure to love your stay.

Cabin features 1 bedroom with queen bed and 1 loft with full size futon bed.

Guests have access to complete cabin.

Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "Hangar 22"
photos/12/caption: Shower with ceiling mounted shower head
photos/14/caption: Downstairs bedroom (king bed)
photos/19/caption: Kitchen , full refrigerator and mini stove.
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, refrigerator and stove. 

There is also a second and a third rental near this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "The Iron Horse" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Please be aware there is a temporary drainage system installed at the front of the concrete pad, this may be a trip hazard, please watch your step.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi. 

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

Hangar 22 is built in memory of Sergeant Shawn Hess.  Sgt. Hess was killed in the line of duty while working as a Deputy Sheriff for Tazewell County Sheriffs Office..  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his friends and family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.


RECENTLY WE HAD TO INSTALL A NEW DRAINAGE SYSTEM AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CABIN.UNTIL THE GROUND SETTLES,THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT LIP ON THE EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PAD ENTRANCE. THIS WILL REQUIRE YOU TO TAKE A SMALL STEP UP, CREATING A TRIPPING HAZARD. PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS STEP UP. IT WILL BE MARKED WITH FLUORESCENT PAINT.PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS AND BE CAREFUL.

sectionedDescription/description:
Great Location! Large Private Lot! Spacious 5 Bedroom / 3 Full Bath Home!
Private lot w/pond off Coal Heritage / Hwy 52  
Plenty of Parking!
Nearby Attractions
Goodson's Grocery Store - 1/2 mile
Gas - 1/2 mile
Wendy's - 1/2 mile
Sterling Drive In - Less than 5 miles
Car Wash - 1 to 2 miles
Warrior Trail & Outlaw Access - 1 mile
Wilimore Dam - 8 miles
Pinnacle Creek Indian Ridge Warrior Connector in Kimball - 10 miles
Berwind Lake - 17 miles
Linkous Park Public Pool - Just a few minutes in Welch

5 Bedrooms - 2 King, 1 Queen, 3 Full (more coming soon to the bunk room) 2 full sofa's, blow up mattress (Linens are provided)
3 Full Baths - 1 Tub, 2 with Stand up showers (Towels are provided)
Kitchen - Fully stocked with dishes, pots/pans, indoor grill, air fryer, crockpot, coffee pot (K-cups or standard pot) and more...
Large Living Room - 2 Full Sofas and 1 Love Seat (Cards and Poker Chips along with a few games are there for those rainy days)
Work Area w/desk and printer
Carport
Covered front porch, Covered side deck and uncovered deck behind garage

You will have access to the entire property

Quiet area just minutes from downtown Welch

sectionedDescription/access: DOOR ENTRY CODE: The house has a lock on the entry door with a numeric keypad. Your entry code will be active from 4PM on your arrival date through 10AM on your departure date. Your door code will be provided in your reminder notice that will be emailed to you upon your final payment.
sectionedDescription/description:
WELCOME TO MOUNTAIN TRAILS OFF-ROAD LODGING WV

We are a small campground but have 2 additional cabins and several campsites that are ideal for either tent camping or toy hauler/RV camping. Our Deluxe furnished cabin is equipped with AC/heat and full size fridges.
 
We cater to ATV, SXS, and off road riders who come to the Southern West Virginia area to ride the trails here. Situated close to HMT and outlaw trails. You can ride from camp with no need to trailer your machines.

DOOR ENTRY CODE: The house has a lock on the entry door with a numeric keypad. Your entry code will be active from 4PM on your arrival date through 10AM on your departure date. Your door code will be provided in your reminder notice that will be emailed to you upon your final payment.

By renting this house you agree to the following terms and conditions:

REMINDER NOTICE: You are responsible for printing and bringing the reminder notice that we will email to you when your final payment is received. The reminder notice will have the physical address of the community for your GPS, gate access instructions, the door entry code as well as some other important information. If you have not received this reminder notice with your final payment confirmation you must let us know prior to your arrival date.

CHECK-IN is at 10:00 AM or after.

CHECK OUT is at 6:00 PM or earlier.
You must check out by 6:00 PM; otherwise, any delays to the check-out give us a charge by the cleaning company is USD $100 per fraction and/or entire hour delayed on your check-out and this charge will be passed on to you via Resolution Center. We reserve the right to remove any luggage and other personal belongings from the house.

OWNER: Owner shall provide all utilities, furnishings, towels, linens and starter bathroom supplies. Owner is not responsible for any utility or cable/internet interruptions during the guests stay but will make every attempt to have the utility/cable company restore their services as soon as possible.

GUEST: Guest agrees to leave unit in the same condition as found. Furniture must be in the same location as when you arrived. Dishes, pots and pans must be properly cleaned as to not have any baked on food, all trash (water bottles, boxes, bags etc) must be picked up and put out for the trash during your stay and upon departure. Any damage to the unit will be your responsibility. You are responsible for making sure the cabin/home is properly secured at all times. Owner assumes no liability for property loss or damage, nor liability for accidents or injury.

**Service calls deemed non-emergencies where a staff member made it out to the property and a non-emergency service was provided after hours will incur a $75 fee. Note that our ability to respond to unforeseen circumstances may vary on a third party provider.**

The house will be inspected before your arrival and immediately after your departure.

sectionedDescription/description:
Hi.  We offer COZY rooms with a BEAUTIFUL view of GREAT Smoky mountains surrounding our property.  KIND and FRIENDLY hosts ready to WELCOME all your needs.

THANK YOU

We are providing a room with two beds or one bed as guests need, in a hotel setting, close to the interstate, providing an easy stopover for our guests traveling along the I-81 and I-77 corridors.  A mexican restaurant, a local barbeque place, and an American diner are nearby for dining options.  A vineyard, an animal park, and New River Trails nearby and a short drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Big Walker Lookout for nature lovers.

Guests will need their car.

our pet fee is $15 per night
Smoking rooms available for $20 more (based on availability).
Smoking in a non smoking room will incur a $150 incidental fee.

primaryHost/about:
PLEASE READ MY REQUIREMENTS BEFORE MAKING A RESERVATION REQUEST.

All guests are welcome whether vaccinated or unvaccinated! Since I was fully vaccinated and got COVID anyway, it shows that they will not prevent it. We can just take the distance precautions and be careful and pray that God will watch over us!!!!

I do not accept guests at all who are smokers. Nor do I like to sit up half the night for late arrivals! Nine pm is the definite cutoff for guests to arrive.

Check in time is 4 pm. Note this please. Please plan to be here no later than nine   pm if possible. In the past when I have accepted late arrivals it sometimes runs as late as midnight or after and that is too much to ask of an Airbnb host. I am not a motel that stays open 24/7! And even though I have this stipulation posted right here, I still have people who ask me to accept them late and I simply will not. 

 Check out is 10 am but based on my activities I  may have to ask guests to check out earlier on some days.  Please be considerate.
 
ALSO, the guest rooms are not pet friendly and I do not allow guests to have pets. So many people ask even though I  have that specified on my listing, so don't even ask because I will not accept. I have to think about the cleanliness of all guests in this respect as I am sure some people would not want to stay in rooms where pets had stayed! I do not even allow my own dog in the rental areas, BTW! Nor do I accept young children as my home is not safe for young kids.

I request you remove shoes worn outside when entering the house and have house shoes as bare feet are not safe. Socks are not safe either as they can be slippery on some types of floors, so house shoes are better for traction.

Absolutely no food or drink in the carpeted bedrooms, East and West. There is a common room available for you to eat and drink so please respect my wishes on this. Coffee, tea, bottled water, and snacks are available in the common room with ample space for multiple guests. NO TAKING COFFEE UP TO A BEDROOM! 

Please do not use fragrances either as I have multiple chemical sensitivity and am allergic to odors.  Fragrance free soap, shampoo, etc. is provided. 

Please pick up roll around luggage so the wheels do not soil the floor or carpets.

 Please let me know when you will arrive as I have to check you in in person.

First and foremost, I am a Christian who believes the truth of the Bible and tries to apply it to each and every moment of my life here on earth.  I consider the Bible a road map for my life.  This doesn't mean that I am a perfect individual, but that I am forgiven!  I have been totally blessed by hosting Airbnb guests from around the world and I love the people and this new adventure in my life.  My motto is Scripture:  I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me;  Philippians 4:13

I am a retired business/computer programming teacher.  I like to read,, use the computer, eat out, do things with friends, and do jigsaw and crossword puzzles.  I also enjoy community activities and am an active Ruritan Club member and a member of the Woodlawn United Methodist Church.  I am also in the Carroll County Retired Teachers Association.  I was a member of the local chapter of the Experimental Aircraft Association that my husband co-founded here at Twin County Airport.  The main focus of the organization is to expose children to aviation and give free airplane rides to children ages 8 - 17.  Regrettably, this organization has disbanded after losing its most avid leader.  

I have three listings on this site which are a Walkout basement, East Bedroom and West Bedroom.  I have learned from previous guests that they do not see all three listings when making reservations, thus I am stating that information here.  so you can search for all of them.  Food is allowed in the basement room, but not allowed in the other two bedrooms.  All of them have private bathrooms.  There is TV available for all who want to watch it. The basement room has a flat 55 inch TV with streaming capabilities via Apple TV . The West bedroom has a smart TV so shows can be accessed by that system with the guest sign-in on Netflix, etc.  The East bedroom has access to a 65 inch smart TV in the balcony on which guests using the East room can sign into accounts and stream shows. This is not accessible by other guests in the house.

All guests have access to mini appliances for fixing meals. However, guests are not allowed to use my kitchen.
  
Please park by the three car garage unless you have reserved the basement room.  Parking on the right side of the house garage is reserved for the occupants of the basement room.  Please read the house rules.  No outdoor shoes in the house, please.  And NO TOBACCO USE OF ANY KIND anywhere on the premises, please.  I have found that not everyone reads all the information listed, thus, some of it is restated here. I do have multiple chemical sensitivity allergies to odors so I provide fragrance free toiletries for the guests. I also request that you carry suitcases and not roll around your luggage on my floors or carpets, please. Every effort is made for cleanliness.

Airbnb will not reveal your picture until after your reservation is accepted. I usually only approve those persons who have positive reviews from other hosts which are posted on the Airbnb site for that prospective guest. If you are new to Airbnb, please include an explanation of who you are and your purpose for traveling.

I am in the southwestern part of the state in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains.      I am only about 15 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and 25 miles from Mt. Airy, NC, which is a great tourist town. Hillsville and Galax are approximately 7 miles away. The home is located about three miles from Interstate 77. Understand you are in the country when you stay at the Homestead. It is totally quiet and peaceful here, other than the resident doggie Cookie who barks very loudly!
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests will have full use of the private bedroom.  They can watch TV in the balcony of the home as there is no TV in this bedroom.  They can use the deck as well, and there is a meeting room available.  They can use the washer and dryer, if necessary.
The dog, Cookie would not be allowed into the areas that are described in the rental information.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located near Galax & Hillsville in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of the southwestern part of Virginia.  It is 80 miles SW of Roanoke and 80 miles N of Winston Salem.  The location is about 3 miles from exit 19 of I-77.  Twin County airport is three miles away.   There is a multitude of activities the area - Hiking, biking, canoeing, horseback riding, etc.  I have three available bedrooms with private baths.  We are only three miles from I-77 with gorgeous quite mountain views.

This home is located in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of the southwestern part of Virginia.  It is 80 miles southwest of Roanoke and 80 miles north of Winston Salem.  The location is about six miles from exit 19 of Interstate 77.  Twin County airport is five miles away.   There is a multitude of activities in which to participate in the area.  Hiking, biking, canoeing, horseback riding, etc.
No check-ins will be accepted after nine pm for any room.

I have three available bedrooms with private baths.  Two of the bedrooms have queen beds and the basement room has a single twin sized bed for one person only.  You should be able to see all three of my offerings on a normal browser on your computer.   I have been told by Airbnb that they all might not show up on an app.  
You can search for any of these names to find my rooms;   See Shirley's Homestead, West Bedroom/ Prvt Bath, the other two sites are named:  Shirley's Homestead Walk-Out Basement Bed/Bath
and Shirley's Homestead, East Bedroom/ Private Bath
so you can search for any of those.  The basement room cost is more than the other two rooms that sleep two.

Eight PM is the cutoff for checking in to the Homestead.  Ten AM is the checkout time.

Guests will have full use of the private bedroom.  They can watch TV in the balcony of the home as there is no TV in this bedroom.  They can use the deck as well, and there is a meeting room available.  They can use the washer and dryer, if necessary.
The dog, Cookie would not be allowed into the areas that are described in the rental information.

I will be happy to help guests in any way possible.

This is a beautiful rural area, peaceful and serene.

Twin County Airport is about five miles away.  They have a courtesy car there.  

There is no public transportation from this residence.  Enterprise rental car is located in Galax. Taxis are available from the towns.

The home is located in the beautiful blue ridge mountains of southwest Virginia midway between the towns of Galax and Hillsville.  Nearby attractions include the NEW RIVER TRAIL which is great for biking, hiking, or horseback riding; beautiful NEW RIVER for kayaking or fishing; the BLUE RIDGE PARKWAY on which you can visit the CHATEAU MORRISETTE winery or the BLUE RIDGE MUSIC CENTER, MABRY MILL which is the most photographed mill in the nation; or just have a nice relaxing drive to view the beautiful scenery along the parkway.  Also off the Parkway is the Villa Appalaccia Winery.
Yearly events include the famous Galax Fiddlers' Convention and the Hillsville Flea Market.  The historic Rex Theater offers music shows every weekend in Galax.  This area is on the Crooked Road Music Trail.
The Chestnut Creek Arts Center is located in Galax.  
Nearby is the town of Hillsville where the historic courthouse is located that is famous for the 1912 Allen Tragedy when they shot up the courthouse.  There is also an excellent museum maintained by the Carroll County Historical Society inside the historic courthouse as well as the Genealogy Club office where one can do family research.  Also located here is the beautiful Beaver Dam Creek Trail which is excellent for hiking.
The Southwestern Farmers' Market is located at exit 14 off Interstate 77 which is 7 miles away.
Golfing is available at Blue Ridge Country Club, just a few miles from the home, or farther away is the Olde Mill Golf Course in Laurel Fork, VA.
The Crossroads Institute is located in Galax which is a "rural entrepreneurial and educational initiative."
Wytheville, VA is only 28 miles away with a 31 minute drive.  This is the location of the Wohlf
Wohlfahrt haus Dinner Theater which produces extremely professional musicals.  The town of Mt. Airy, NC is also just 28 miles away (35 minute drive), the home of Andy Griffith and is a delightful place to tour.
A list of local churches can be provided as well.
Distances to sights to see are:
36 min (28.2 mi) via US-58   to Mabry Mill
43 min (33.1 mi) via US-58   to Chateau Morrisette Winery
45 min (34.4 mi) via US-58   to Villa Appalaccia Winery

so you can search for any of those.  The basement room cost is more than the other two rooms that sleep two.

Eight PM is the cutoff for checking in to the Homestead.  Ten AM is the checkout time.
sectionedDescription/summary: Located near Galax & Hillsville in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of the southwestern part of Virginia.  It is 80 miles SW of Roanoke and 80 miles N of Winston Salem.  The location is about 3 miles from exit 19 of I-77.  Twin County airport is three miles away.   There is a multitude of activities the area - Hiking, biking, canoeing, horseback riding, etc.  I have three available bedrooms with private baths.  We are only three miles from I-77 with gorgeous quite mountain views.
sectionedDescription/transit:
Twin County Airport is about five miles away.  They have a courtesy car there.  

There is no public transportation from this residence.  Enterprise rental car is located in Galax. Taxis are available from the towns.

primaryHost/about: Welcome! We are glad to host you during your stay at Hungry Mother State Park!
sectionedDescription/access:
Access to the lake trail is located directly across from the property. The Clyburn trail is adjacent to the property. 

In addition to the hiking and biking trails of Hungry Mother Park, there is a beach area (with concessions), a gift shop (inside the park and at Camp Burson), playground areas, canoe, paddle boat, kayak, and paddle board rentals.
sectionedDescription/description:
Campside Cottage--a vacation retreat located across from Camp Burson at the entrance of Hungry Mother State Park in Marion, Virginia.  Relax around the campfire,  hike or bike the many trails.  Lounge on the beach with a good book, or cast your line to catch a big one!  Enjoy the beautiful views of the Appalachian mountains while paddleboarding or kayaking Hungry Mother Lake.  Don't forget to go shopping or sample the restaurants of America's Coolest Hometown!  Enjoy your stay!

Campside Cottage is a clean, newly- renovated modern farmhouse style retreat. It is an upstairs unit with a separate entrance (the downstairs is also a vacation rental with a separate entrance located at the opposite end of the house). There is a very large backyard (field) that kids can play in, and the driveway is perfect for bike riding. There is plenty of parking and you can enjoy the flicker of campfires from the campground across the road while having your own large, private area to yourself. There is a fire pit and outdoor seating area, plus a grill (both gas and charcoal provided) for outdoor cooking. The Campside Cottage is perfect for the couple looking to get away for a few days, or for the young family with small children.  Parents and guests of Emory & Henry Health Sciences students--we are located 2 miles from the Marion campus and would love to host you when you visit!

Access to the lake trail is located directly across from the property. The Clyburn trail is adjacent to the property. 

In addition to the hiking and biking trails of Hungry Mother Park, there is a beach area (with concessions), a gift shop (inside the park and at Camp Burson), playground areas, canoe, paddle boat, kayak, and paddle board rentals.

Guests will have complete privacy with self check-in. A lockbox allows flexibility for guests’ arrival times. A code will be sent to you prior to check-in. There is a list of instructions located within the cottage regarding check-out. Host phone numbers are located inside the rental. 

Message me on the Airbnb app or text/call me if there are any issues or anything that you need help with. I will respond promptly in order to ensure that you to have the best stay possible!!!

Check out the online Guidebook!

Campside Cottage is located at the entrance to Hungry Mother State Park, directly across from Camp Burson campground. Situated on 3.5 acres, there is plenty of privacy. Also, located on the property is the downstairs of this unit (also a vacation rental) as well as two additional vacation rentals (The Berry Cabin and Dreamer’s Lodge). Our property (@ the lake) ends at the fence at the back of the 3.5 acres. Beyond this fence is our neighbors…please respect their privacy! :)

Plenty of parking on site. The neighborhood is very quiet and very safe.

Downtown Marion has many excellent restaurants (Mi Puerto, Macados, Wooden Pickle, Moondog, Sisters’ Cafe & Gifts, Sur 81 to name a few, as well as many fast-food chains) and shopping (Blue Ridge Outfitters, Marion Outdoors, Army/Navy Store, Just Believe Boutique, The Daisy Boutique, Willbeez Country Store and Deli, The Toy Box and others). 

Take in a movie, or a game of putt-putt at Park Place Drive-In. Grab an ice-cream at Park Place or some fudge at Willbeez Country Store and Deli. Enjoy a cup of coffee or some pastry at Better Coffee Co. or Starbucks. 


Marion’s own Lincoln Theatre, one of the last remaining Mayan Revival style theaters in the world, provides a variety of performing arts events. 

And just a short drive away…Barter Theatre, Wohlfahrt Haus Dinner Theatre, Grayson Highlands Park, The Virginia Creeper Trail, Bristol Raceway, Pinnacle Shopping Center, The Back of the Dragon, the Appalachian Trail.

name: Indian Creek Retreat
primaryHost/about: I am a pharmacist from rural Appalachian Virginia. Married with 2 adult children with whom I enjoy traveling the world whenever possible.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire downstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.
sectionedDescription/description:
1 Bedroom apartment in Cedar Bluff Virginia town limits. Sleeps 2-4. Friendly community. Tranquil setting in a rural town with a creek flowing nearby. 5 minutes to Richlands, Virginia. 10 minutes from the local hospital, Clinch Valley Medical Center.  20 minutes to Tazewell Virginia. 15 minutes to the Dragon's Back. 75 minutes to Bristol Motor Speedway. Multiple 4-wheeler trails nearby. Local Trout streams 30 minutes in any direction. Washer/Dryer access. Free Coffee.  Free Wifi.  Free Parking.

Grocery stores and pharmacies are conveniently located only 6 minutes away. Only 1 mile from the Blue Tornadoes Football field. If you happen to be a football fan you can find the whole town at Richlands High School on Friday nights during the fall.

The entire downstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.

Available by phone. We live locally so are available in the event of an emergency.

Enjoy gorgeous foliage and a breathtaking view at Cedar Bluff Overlook. It is about a 30-minute hike on a marked trail. Enjoy scenic drives through the Clinch Mountains, East River Mountains, and the Appalachian Mountains all around the area.
The Cedar Bluff Heritage Festival occurs annually on the third Saturday of September. You will find antique dealers and food vendors among many other activities. The festival attracts thousands of visitors and hundreds of vendors each year.  OKTOBREWFEST is a festival that is held on beautiful historic Main St. Tazewell, VA the first Saturday of October and was created to promote the craft beer industry in southwest VA and the surrounding area. It is the Premier Craft Beer Festival of the Heart of Appalachia.  There are several local restaurants of note, Cuz’s restaurant has been named the best in off-the-beaten-track restaurant categories. Bearded Moose is a frequented local barbecue restaurant loved by locals, and you can enjoy a sweet treat at Sugarfoot Bakery only 6 minutes away. Painted Peak Brewing Company is approximately 25 minutes away from the apartment where you can sample local brews. Multiple hiking trails and 4 wheeler trails are options for your entertainment. Kayaking and canoeing are available at local lakes and rivers. Enjoy Crab Orchard Museum located about 15 minutes away to learn more about the history in our area.
The apartment is located approximately 30 min from the Appalachian College of Pharmacy and approximately 13 minutes from Southwest Community College. Raven Theater is a historic site located about 10 minutes away. Limited show-times and hours, but when they are open it is a special stop for soda fountain ice cream.  Broadway Cinemas is the local contemporary theater located about 6 minutes away.

The town of Cedar Bluff has sidewalks with lights and you can enjoy a leisurely afternoon stroll. 4 County Transit offers public transportation. Town route fare is 25¢ per boarding.
Work express fare is 50¢ per boarding.
College routes are public routes and open to anyone who wants to ride. Fare for public riders is $1.00 per boarding.
College route fare is FREE for college students and staff/faculty who present college ID, seniors at least 60 years old, and children 5 or younger who are accompanied by an adult.
At your request, the bus can stop at other locations that are along its route. This is a route deviation service. 
Please call at least 48 hours in advance with your requests. 
Check out their website for additional information.

primaryHost/about: I’m a middle school teacher who loves the outdoors, and to travel. Im outgoing, enjoy meeting new people.
sectionedDescription/access: All rooms in this property is accessible to guest including laundry and the grounds around the house are available for outdoor quiet pleasures ( yard games, cookout etc)
sectionedDescription/description:
The roomy outdoor getaway near the mountains is just that. . .A large older renovated home in the small town of Athens, WV. As you drive the 3 miles into town from I 77 you see a beautiful view of the Appalachian mountains. 
The getaway is a country home, offering a big front porch with rocking chairs to unwind from a busy day of exploring.

The house is two levels with one bedroom and one bath on the main level and three bedrooms and the second bath upstairs. There's room to spread out and enjoy space. The home  has gas wall heaters to instantly heat rooms. There’s a temperature controlled floor furnace / window air conditioner for the living areas. There is a box or ceiling fan in all bedrooms. The kitchen is stocked with all your standard cookware to make a delicious meal and a nice size dining room to fit up to eight people. We have coffee, tea, sugar, creamer, and bottles of water in the refrigerator. We also have a basket with breakfast / snack items. The house has a laundry closet in the downstairs bathroom, and of course we provide all your linens and towels. We also have TVs in the bedrooms with DVD players and a drawer full of DVDs as well as games and books. We have a fire pit with wood and chairs to enjoy some s'mores.

All rooms in this property is accessible to guest including laundry and the grounds around the house are available for outdoor quiet pleasures ( yard games, cookout etc)

I don’t live on site, but very close. If I’m not there to welcome you, I’ll check in on you during your stay if possible. I’m available to answer any questions you have by text or call.

Athens has a very nice town park which has just been renovated with all kinds of new equipment for the little ones to play on. There are college level sporting events within walking distance at Concord University. There are four water falls within an hours drive and water fun to be had by all at three different nearby lakes. We always recommend Pipestem State Park because it has so many fun activities. It has horseback riding, zip lining splash, park, lake with paddle boats, canoes, kayaks, and a beach area with inflatable's in the water. It also has 3 golf courses (a regular 18 hole and a 3 par 9 hole course, and putt putt), along with loads of hiking/ biking trails, and even ax throwing.

Although we are in a small town, we are within walking distance to:
Concord University, Dollar General, CVS, Tutor's Biscuit World, Moe's pizza, 1st Community Bank, different denominational churches, Athens town park, and Deli mart gas station. All other conveniences are one exit down on I77 where you'll find: Walmart, groceries, restaurants, and a brewery. We also have two wedding venues just down the road as well. 
Getting around is easier by car but there is public transportation. The  Bluefield Area Transit stops near the CVS within a 5 min. walk from the house. They service Bluefield, Princeton, Athens and Welch.

Athen's elevation of 2,585ft is small compared to the Winterplace ski resort at 3,600 ft. Winterplace has been voted as the most accessible, affordable place to learn to ski or board in the southeast! It has 90 acres of 28 trails, and the largest snow tubing park in West Virginia. Our weekends fill up quickly during skiing season. 
Whether you are on a business trip, visiting family or vacationing, our house location along with it's charm and amenities should be able to comfortably meet your needs while visiting the area.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Check-in is after 3 PM 
Check out by 11 AM
Guest should leave the house how they found it or there could be additional charges.
Please keep noise levels down and be respectful of neighbors.

primaryHost/about: My husband and I live on the adjoining property.  Our cabin has a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere that includes free fishing in all the  ponds.  We are about  10 minutes away from several restaurants and gas stations.  We live close to areas that offer golf, whitewater rafting , trail riding, state parks ( New River Gorge )  and much more. We are  less than 10 min. away from beautiful Lake Stevens where you can enjoy your boat, kayaking, hiking , or the beach.  During the winter months we welcome guest who enjoy skiing and  tubing at Winter Place .

primaryHost/about: Husband & Wife with two sons and two dogs, who live on a farm in the mountains of rural WV.  We love enjoying the relaxing peace of farm life!
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to the cottage house and acreage around that home outdoor fire ring with firewood available, as well as charcoal grill and miles of trails. Two ponds on the property for feeding fish and catch and release fishing. Apple picking during Sept and October with two apple trees in the yard, and numerous trees on the property!
sectionedDescription/description:
Come enjoy quiet seclusion on a 140 acre farm located 5 miles from Winterplace ski resort and Weathered Grounds Brewery in Ghent WV! Self check-in on a private half mile long road. Feed the fish with two ponds full of trout,  blue gill, coy, bass and catfish.  Hike or mountain bike on logging trails throughout the property while stopping to pick blackberries or apples. Then come drink hot chocolate next to the fireplace, or have a glass of wine while watching the sunset on the covered porch!

The space is the entire 3 bedroom cottage.  This cottage house sleeps 8 people comfortably.  There are also two friendly German Shepherds at our home on the property inside our home.

Guests have access to the cottage house and acreage around that home outdoor fire ring with firewood available, as well as charcoal grill and miles of trails. Two ponds on the property for feeding fish and catch and release fishing. Apple picking during Sept and October with two apple trees in the yard, and numerous trees on the property!

Hosts live in separate residence on property.

Odd WV is a rural town, off of the Ghent exit, between Beckley and Princeton WV. This secluded farm property  is 25 mins from Beckley and Princeton, and 40 mins from Fayetteville.  Fayetteville is the home of white water rafting, rock climbing, Outdoor Mountain Music Festivals, as well as, many local farm to table restaurants, independent coffee shops and breweries .   Our farm is also a hour from Summersville, Lewisburg and White Sulfur Springs, home of the Greenbriar.  It is also 1 hour from Blacksburg VA.

On the property mountain biking and hiking are good options for exploring.  Miles of old logging trails are available for this. 
From  the months of  Oct- March 4 wheel drive or AWD vehicles are necessary for accessing the property due to the large amount of snow that falls here.

Entire 140 acres are fenced in, so miles of hiking and you will not go off of the farm unless you cross over a fence line.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Must have 4 wheel drive vehicle if you book with us during Oct-March
Must follow checkout procedure requirements.
No swimming in ponds or climbing in treehouse.

additionalHouseRules:
-Prior to 11:00 on the day of departure, the Tenant will clean up the surrounding property before checkout otherwise check-out cleaning charges to you will result.  
-ACCOMMODATIONS: Tenant is responsible for keeping the unit clean and safe during the entire tenancy. Tenant has an obligation to notify Owner immediately of any safety issues discovered. In addition, Tenant is responsible for any and all damages to the property from all guests and ensuring maximum occupancy is not exceeded during his tenancy. Due to health department regulations, occupancy in homes served by septic systems is limited to two persons per bedroom, unless otherwise stated. 
-This cabin is designated as smoke free and therefore no smoking is permitted inside the structure.  
-All cabins are equipped for normal housekeeping. Each unit includes an electric coffee pot and toaster as basic kitchen equipment; dishwasher, washer/dryer, central air/heat, and microwave. All beds will have linens and pillows provided.
-Mail, texts, and phone messages can be sent to 304-466-4444 or carolynpricestephens@gmail.com or 624 Tallery Mountain Road, Hinton, WV 25951.
-CHECK-OUTS: All cabins must be vacated by 11:00 on check-out day. We ask that this policy be recognized by all Tenants. An extra day’s rent will be charged for all late check-outs unless advance arrangements have been made for late check out (limited availability and subject to additional fee.  Lessee is responsible for washing dishes, bagging trash, emptying refrigerator, leaving the AC set on 78 degrees (or heat set on 55 degrees in the winter months), securing all doors and windows, and leaving the unit clean, damage-free and in good condition for the next renter. Any extra cleaning or excessive trash removal will be billed to Tenant at a minimum fee of $50.00. Please ensure you’ve packed all your belongings before checking out, as we cannot be responsible for items left. A $15.00 COD fee will apply for any items returned to you following your tenancy. Call our office for arrangements within 7 days after your departure, otherwise left items will be disposed. 
-We do not allow pets unless prior arrangements are made (registered service animals excepted). The Tenant will be responsible for cleaning after the animals inside and outside the cabin. 
-The Tenant, guests and all the occupants of the vacation home agrees to release and indemnify the Owner from and against all claims for damages and/or personal injuries to any person arising out of the use of subject premises, including interior and all exterior areas, including decks, stairs and other common areas that occurred during the tenancy of the premises.  Tenant agrees to be responsible for any repairs necessary due to their negligence.  

Let me know if you need anything.  


Carolyn

primaryHost/about: My husband is a retired German Language professor and I am still loving my work as a school psychologist.   We travel, read, and grow wonderful flowers in our little piece of the world.    When not on Tallery Mountain, we keep returning to Saint Malo, France.  We love the food, the sea and the history there almost as much as the food, the mountains and the history here.   We are West Virginians, born and raised.  Company is always welcome.
sectionedDescription/description:
On Tallery Mountain in Summers County, WV, it's almost Heaven to just sit on the back porch and watch the sunset.

In the heart of white water rafting, curvy motorcycle roads and golf courses, comfortable quarters are guaranteed after a hike or a day of fishing on the Bluestone or New Rivers.   Within 90 minutes is the Blue Ridge Parkway, New River Bridge, Pipestem, Bluestone, Babcock and Hawks Nest State Parks, The Greenbrier Resort, Tamarack, and historic Lewisburg.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
-Prior to 11:00 on the day of departure, the Tenant will clean up the surrounding property before checkout otherwise check-out cleaning charges to you will result.  
-ACCOMMODATIONS: Tenant is responsible for keeping the unit clean and safe during the entire tenancy. Tenant has an obligation to notify Owner immediately of any safety issues discovered. In addition, Tenant is responsible for any and all damages to the property from all guests and ensuring maximum occupancy is not exceeded during his tenancy. Due to health department regulations, occupancy in homes served by septic systems is limited to two persons per bedroom, unless otherwise stated. 
-This cabin is designated as smoke free and therefore no smoking is permitted inside the structure.  
-All cabins are equipped for normal housekeeping. Each unit includes an electric coffee pot and toaster as basic kitchen equipment; dishwasher, washer/dryer, central air/heat, and microwave. All beds will have linens and pillows provided.
-Mail, texts, and phone messages can be sent to 304-466-4444 or carolynpricestephens@gmail.com or 624 Tallery Mountain Road, Hinton, WV 25951.
-CHECK-OUTS: All cabins must be vacated by 11:00 on check-out day. We ask that this policy be recognized by all Tenants. An extra day’s rent will be charged for all late check-outs unless advance arrangements have been made for late check out (limited availability and subject to additional fee.  Lessee is responsible for washing dishes, bagging trash, emptying refrigerator, leaving the AC set on 78 degrees (or heat set on 55 degrees in the winter months), securing all doors and windows, and leaving the unit clean, damage-free and in good condition for the next renter. Any extra cleaning or excessive trash removal will be billed to Tenant at a minimum fee of $50.00. Please ensure you’ve packed all your belongings before checking out, as we cannot be responsible for items left. A $15.00 COD fee will apply for any items returned to you following your tenancy. Call our office for arrangements within 7 days after your departure, otherwise left items will be disposed. 
-We do not allow pets unless prior arrangements are made (registered service animals excepted). The Tenant will be responsible for cleaning after the animals inside and outside the cabin. 
-The Tenant, guests and all the occupants of the vacation home agrees to release and indemnify the Owner from and against all claims for damages and/or personal injuries to any person arising out of the use of subject premises, including interior and all exterior areas, including decks, stairs and other common areas that occurred during the tenancy of the premises.  Tenant agrees to be responsible for any repairs necessary due to their negligence.  

Let me know if you need anything.  


Carolyn 
304-466-4444

primaryHost/about: Husband, Dad, Papaw, Pastor, Hunter, Fisherman, Biker, Outdoorsman.  Have lived in the Mountains of WV most of my life.  Been riding and hunting here for 50 years.  This is our twenty three acre family homestead since 1972.  Come enjoy the peace and serenity of Almost Heaven WV.

sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet, peaceful Horse Farm in the Mountains of West Virginia.

Plenty of open space. Enjoy the mountain air. Close to the new Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail.  Unload and you won’t have to haul your ATV/UTV again until you head home.  Many outlaw trails nearby. Right off Rt16.  

If you like riding curves on  motorcycles or sports cars we’re only 30 minutes from Back of the Dragon Visitors Center. 15 minutes to Berwind Lake. A great place to get away from it all!!

No access to attached garage.

Available for questions by phone text or email.

304-320-3627
Twboyd59@gmail.com

Close access to Hatfield McCoy trail.  Right off Rt 16. Enjoy Berwind Lake nearby.  Rural mountain valley setting.  Quiet peaceful place to unwind, relax, and get back to nature.

Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail is accessible within two miles of the property.  Once you unload you won’t need to haul again until you head home.  If you like curves and ride motorcycles Rt 16 is at the end of the driveway with Back of the dragon only 30 minutes away.

The garage is not included in rental. No smoking or pets allowed. Please remove shoes when inside.  Hi speed WiFi access.  Roku Streaming available.  Please leave money for any purchases.

There is absolutely no illegal drug use allowed of any sort.  If you are caught you will be asked to leave and the police will be called.  Sorry I even have to mention this but it’s the world we live in. One bad apple……….

sectionedDescription/access: Private drive and plenty of parking.
sectionedDescription/description:
Log Cabin just 3 minutes from Pipestem State Park.  This cabin offers 2 bedrooms 1.5 baths, is furnished with nice up to date furniture and beds, has central heat and air, fireplace,  3 Roku TVs, Washer Dryer,  Front and back screened porches. This is a great place to get away from it all. Cabin is within minutes of two lakes, three rivers, beautiful waterfalls, great fishing, hiking, golf courses, horseback riding, kayaking, zip lines, and nature trails. We're open year-round!

King master bedroom, Queen 2nd bedroom upstairs.  Furnished kitchen with new samsung washer dryer. Screened front and back porches with swing on both. coffee maker, and coffee provided.

Private drive and plenty of parking.

Host can be reached by email.  
rowz10.rb@gmail.com
phone: 229-848-0420

Peaceful quiet area in the country.  3 min from Pipestem Resort State Park.
Park offers bikingand hiking trails,  horseback riding, aerial tramway, zip lines, lake and river fishing. Waterfalls nearby, and  Bluestone lake and recreation area 15 miles away for boating and fishing. Marina with boat rentals available.

Car is the best way to get around the area. Park offers many biking and hiking trails.

Enjoy our cabin, and the area.
Please clean up behind yourself and wash dishes, remove bedding  and take trash to bins before leaving. 
Also no shoes inside please and thanks.

name: Mountain Momma - clean and convenient!
photos/4/caption: Seating for 6, wings fold down for more space around the room.
photos/10/caption: Extra towels, cleaning products, linens available in the living room closet.
primaryHost/about: I am a husband, a father of four and I enjoy good books.  We are a pretty relaxed family and we are very active in our community in southern West Virginia.  Please contact me with any concerns.
sectionedDescription/access: It’s all yours!
sectionedDescription/description:
Mountain Momma is an above-garage apartment in Iaeger, WV.  We are located just a few miles from the Outlaw Trails trailhead at Wilmore Dam, and 12 miles from the Hatfield McCoy trailhead in Welch.  Other nearby HM trails are in Gilbert and War.   The newly-remodeled home offers two bedrooms and one bathroom, with additional sleeping in the living room.   The kitchen has concrete countertops and soft-close cabinets.  A Dollar General store is 1/4 mile away, and we have parking for ATV's.

All of the work on this apartment was completed by 120+ volunteers from 10+ states in 2018-2019.  As Covid-19 has ended the mentoring internship program typically hosted in this housing, we are turning over a new leaf.

It’s all yours!

Our family lives adjacent to this building in our split-level home.  We have young kids who are very friendly and polite!  We will give you your space but are available for whatever you might need.  Our heart is to serve you, see to it you enjoy the stay and earn your 5-star review

We are on Route 52 in Iaeger, the main road in our county.  This is a safe small-town place.

Parking is across the street in an open field for vehicles with trailers.  If no trailer, use the driveway if it's convenient for you.

sectionedDescription/description:
5 bedroom 3 bath home built in 1920. This home can easily accommodate 20 guests. High ceilings and large rooms. Spacious yard to grill and enjoy the WV mountain air. 8 foot slate pool table! Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Unload and ride right from the house!

Entire house and garage
sectionedDescription/summary: 5 bedroom 3 bath home built in 1920. This home can easily accommodate 20 guests. High ceilings and large rooms. Spacious yard to grill and enjoy the WV mountain air. 8 foot slate pool table! Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Unload and ride right from the house!

additionalHouseRules:
I expect guests to be respectful of my property and possessions.  I request that there be NO SMOKING any where on the premises including the farm land.  I would hope they would take off their outdoor shoes before going on carpeted areas to help me keep the inside of the house clean.  I would not want loud music or a noisy TV at any time to be used above the normal tones.  I would expect the guests to clean up after themselves.  No pets allowed.  No food or drink is to be taken into carpeted areas, east and west bedrooms.  Food is allowed in the walk out basement room and the party room which is available for cooking simple meals for guests in the east and west bedrooms.    Please do not roll you luggage on the hardwood floors or the carpets, pick up the roll arounds to move them through the house to prevent scratching or soiling the floors.  
Since I have multiple chemical sensitivity with some odors, I respectfully request that guests use non-fragrant lotions and cosmetics---NO PERFUMES, please.

primaryHost/about:
PLEASE READ MY REQUIREMENTS BEFORE MAKING A RESERVATION REQUEST.

All guests are welcome whether vaccinated or unvaccinated! Since I was fully vaccinated and got COVID anyway, it shows that they will not prevent it. We can just take the distance precautions and be careful and pray that God will watch over us!!!!

I do not accept guests at all who are smokers. Nor do I like to sit up half the night for late arrivals! Nine pm is the definite cutoff for guests to arrive.

Check in time is 4 pm. Note this please. Please plan to be here no later than nine   pm if possible. In the past when I have accepted late arrivals it sometimes runs as late as midnight or after and that is too much to ask of an Airbnb host. I am not a motel that stays open 24/7! And even though I have this stipulation posted right here, I still have people who ask me to accept them late and I simply will not. 

 Check out is 10 am but based on my activities I  may have to ask guests to check out earlier on some days.  Please be considerate.
 
ALSO, the guest rooms are not pet friendly and I do not allow guests to have pets. So many people ask even though I  have that specified on my listing, so don't even ask because I will not accept. I have to think about the cleanliness of all guests in this respect as I am sure some people would not want to stay in rooms where pets had stayed! I do not even allow my own dog in the rental areas, BTW! Nor do I accept young children as my home is not safe for young kids.

I request you remove shoes worn outside when entering the house and have house shoes as bare feet are not safe. Socks are not safe either as they can be slippery on some types of floors, so house shoes are better for traction.

Absolutely no food or drink in the carpeted bedrooms, East and West. There is a common room available for you to eat and drink so please respect my wishes on this. Coffee, tea, bottled water, and snacks are available in the common room with ample space for multiple guests. NO TAKING COFFEE UP TO A BEDROOM! 

Please do not use fragrances either as I have multiple chemical sensitivity and am allergic to odors.  Fragrance free soap, shampoo, etc. is provided. 

Please pick up roll around luggage so the wheels do not soil the floor or carpets.

 Please let me know when you will arrive as I have to check you in in person.

First and foremost, I am a Christian who believes the truth of the Bible and tries to apply it to each and every moment of my life here on earth.  I consider the Bible a road map for my life.  This doesn't mean that I am a perfect individual, but that I am forgiven!  I have been totally blessed by hosting Airbnb guests from around the world and I love the people and this new adventure in my life.  My motto is Scripture:  I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me;  Philippians 4:13

I am a retired business/computer programming teacher.  I like to read,, use the computer, eat out, do things with friends, and do jigsaw and crossword puzzles.  I also enjoy community activities and am an active Ruritan Club member and a member of the Woodlawn United Methodist Church.  I am also in the Carroll County Retired Teachers Association.  I was a member of the local chapter of the Experimental Aircraft Association that my husband co-founded here at Twin County Airport.  The main focus of the organization is to expose children to aviation and give free airplane rides to children ages 8 - 17.  Regrettably, this organization has disbanded after losing its most avid leader.  

I have three listings on this site which are a Walkout basement, East Bedroom and West Bedroom.  I have learned from previous guests that they do not see all three listings when making reservations, thus I am stating that information here.  so you can search for all of them.  Food is allowed in the basement room, but not allowed in the other two bedrooms.  All of them have private bathrooms.  There is TV available for all who want to watch it. The basement room has a flat 55 inch TV with streaming capabilities via Apple TV . The West bedroom has a smart TV so shows can be accessed by that system with the guest sign-in on Netflix, etc.  The East bedroom has access to a 65 inch smart TV in the balcony on which guests using the East room can sign into accounts and stream shows. This is not accessible by other guests in the house.

All guests have access to mini appliances for fixing meals. However, guests are not allowed to use my kitchen.
  
Please park by the three car garage unless you have reserved the basement room.  Parking on the right side of the house garage is reserved for the occupants of the basement room.  Please read the house rules.  No outdoor shoes in the house, please.  And NO TOBACCO USE OF ANY KIND anywhere on the premises, please.  I have found that not everyone reads all the information listed, thus, some of it is restated here. I do have multiple chemical sensitivity allergies to odors so I provide fragrance free toiletries for the guests. I also request that you carry suitcases and not roll around your luggage on my floors or carpets, please. Every effort is made for cleanliness.

Airbnb will not reveal your picture until after your reservation is accepted. I usually only approve those persons who have positive reviews from other hosts which are posted on the Airbnb site for that prospective guest. If you are new to Airbnb, please include an explanation of who you are and your purpose for traveling.

I am in the southwestern part of the state in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains.      I am only about 15 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and 25 miles from Mt. Airy, NC, which is a great tourist town. Hillsville and Galax are approximately 7 miles away. The home is located about three miles from Interstate 77. Understand you are in the country when you stay at the Homestead. It is totally quiet and peaceful here, other than the resident doggie Cookie who barks very loudly!
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests will have full use of the private bedroom.  They can watch TV in the balcony of the home as there is no TV in this bedroom.  They are welcome to work on the jigsaw puzzle that is constantly available.  They can use the deck as well, and there is a meeting room available.  A community room can also be made available if needed.  In addition to this one See Shirley's Homestead, West Bedroom/ Prvt Bath, the other two sites are named:  Shirley's Homestead Walk-Out Basement Bed/Bath
and Shirley's Homestead, East Bedroom/ Private Bath
so you can search for any of those.  The basement room cost is a bit more than the other two rooms that sleep two.



The dog, Cookie would not be allowed into the areas that are described in the rental information.

Guests will not be accepted later than 9 pm.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located near Galax & Hillsville, Mt. Airy, NC and Wytheville, VA in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of southwest Virginia.  It is 80 miles SW of Roanoke and 80 miles north of Winston Salem.  We are only three miles from I-77, exit 19, with gorgeous quiet mountain views. Twin County airport is three miles away.   There is a multitude of activities the area - Hiking, biking, canoeing, horseback riding, etc.  I have three available bedrooms with private baths.

This home is located in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of the southwestern part of Virginia.  It is 80 miles southwest of Roanoke and 80 miles north of Winston Salem.  The location is about three miles from exit 19 of Interstate 77.  Twin County airport is three miles away.   There is a multitude of activities in which to participate in the area.  Hiking, biking, canoeing, horseback riding, etc.

I have three available bedrooms with private baths.  Two of the bedrooms have queen beds and the basement room has a single twin sized bed for one person only.  You should be able to see all three of my offerings on a normal browser on your computer.   I have been told by Airbnb that they all might not show up on an app.

Guests will not be accepted any later than 9 pm.

Guests will have full use of the private bedroom.  They can watch TV in the balcony of the home as there is no TV in this bedroom.  They are welcome to work on the jigsaw puzzle that is constantly available.  They can use the deck as well, and there is a meeting room available.  A community room can also be made available if needed.  In addition to this one See Shirley's Homestead, West Bedroom/ Prvt Bath, the other two sites are named:  Shirley's Homestead Walk-Out Basement Bed/Bath
and Shirley's Homestead, East Bedroom/ Private Bath
so you can search for any of those.  The basement room cost is a bit more than the other two rooms that sleep two.



The dog, Cookie would not be allowed into the areas that are described in the rental information.

Guests will not be accepted later than 9 pm.

I would be happy to help guests in any way possible.

This is a quiet country atmosphere where one can totally relax.

Enterprise car rental is in Galax.  Taxi service is available in the towns.  There is no public transit from this residence.

There are trails throughout the 85 acre forest area where guests would be welcome to hike.  ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING anywhere on this land.
Nearby attractions include the NEW RIVER TRAIL which is great for biking, hiking, or horseback riding; beautiful NEW RIVER for kayaking or fishing; the BLUE RIDGE PARKWAY on which you can visit the CHATEAU MORRISETTE winery or the BLUE RIDGE MUSIC CENTER, MABRY MILL which is the most photographed mill in the nation; or just have a nice relaxing drive to view the beautiful scenery along the parkway.  Also off the Parkway is the Villa Appalaccia Winery.
Yearly events include the famous Galax Fiddlers' Convention and the Hillsville Flea Market.  The historic Rex Theater offers music shows every weekend in Galax.  This area is on the Crooked Road Music Trail.
The Chestnut Creek Arts Center is located in Galax.  
Nearby is the town of Hillsville where the historic courthouse is located that is famous for the 1912 Allen Tragedy when they shot up the courthouse.  There is also an excellent museum maintained by the Carroll County Historical Society inside the historic courthouse as well as the Genealogy Club office where one can do family research.  Also located here is the beautiful Beaver Dam Creek Trail which is excellent for hiking.
The Southwestern Farmers' Market is located at exit 14 off Interstate 77 which is 7 miles away.
Golfing is available at Blue Ridge Country Club, just a few miles from the home, or farther away is the Olde Mill Golf Course in Laurel Fork, VA.
The Crossroads Institute is located in Galax which is a "rural entrepreneurial and educational initiative."
Wytheville, VA is only 28 miles away with a 31 minute drive.  This is the location of the Wohlf
Wohlfahrt haus Dinner Theater which produces extremely professional musicals.  The town of Mt. Airy, NC is also just 28 miles away (35 minute drive), the home of Andy Griffith and is a delightful place to tour.
A list of local churches can be provided as well.
No pets allowed. 
 Absolutely NO SMOKING anywhere on the premises or farmland.  No food is provided but guests would have kitchen privileges as well as the use of the balcony for watching television or working on puzzles, and the deck for enjoying the mountain views and watching the turkeys, deer and other wildlife.  There is a meeting room that could be available if needed as well.  There are trails throughout the 85 acre forest area where guests would be welcome to hike.  ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING anywhere on this land.

Hosts are Shirley and Cookie.  No pets allowed.   Absolutely NO SMOKING anywhere on the premises or farmland.

Nine PM is the cut off for check ins.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
I expect guests to be respectful of my property and possessions.  I request that there be NO SMOKING any where on the premises including the farm land.  I would hope they would take off their outdoor shoes before going on carpeted areas to help me keep the inside of the house clean.  I would not want loud music or a noisy TV at any time to be used above the normal tones.  I would expect the guests to clean up after themselves.  No pets allowed.  No food or drink is to be taken into carpeted areas, east and west bedrooms.  Food is allowed in the walk out basement room and the party room which is available for cooking simple meals for guests in the east and west bedrooms.    Please do not roll you luggage on the hardwood floors or the carpets, pick up the roll arounds to move them through the house to prevent scratching or soiling the floors.  
Since I have multiple chemical sensitivity with some odors, I respectfully request that guests use non-fragrant lotions and cosmetics---NO PERFUMES, please.
sectionedDescription/interaction: I would be happy to help guests in any way possible.
