primaryHost/about: I taught school for 13 years. I assist my husband with our rental property. I enjoy painting and fixing up property.
sectionedDescription/access:
Quail Rd is the first green state rd. sign to the left past Buffalo Trail Resort.
Go over the bridge and stay to the left. Stay straight.
Go to the very end of Quail Rd and the house has a red roof.
Trucks and trailers HAVE TO ENTER the upper left gravel driveway and turn left. This driveway loops downward. You drive to the lower end and backup your trailer into the graveled area in the corner. Two trucks and trailers can park in this corner. This will allow more room for trucks and trailers to park on the lower gravel. Large trailers over 30ft need to exit out the upper gravel road where you entered.
sectionedDescription/description:
Large spacious house for families and friends! Ride your ATV anywhere! No trailering to HM trails (Pocahontas 2 miles)  Indian Ridge, Pinnacle, Warrior, Spearhead & the Outlaw Trails! Lots of parking for many trailers! With all the ATVs going by on 71, there's peace and quiet on this nestled 4 acres up the hill at the end of Quail Rd.  Grill on the patio, stay warm in the family room with a gas fireplace, or sit by the fire pit. Restaurants, gas, grocery, car wash, and laundromat nearby.

Main Bedroom One has 1 king bed
Bedroom Two has 1 queen bed and 3 twin beds
Bedroom Three has 2 queen beds 
Bedroom Four has 1 queen bed and 1 twin bed
Bedroom Five has 1 queen 
The large family room is 20 x 30 and has a Lazyboy pullout sofa and there’s an Airbed available

Quail Rd is the first green state rd. sign to the left past Buffalo Trail Resort.
Go over the bridge and stay to the left. Stay straight.
Go to the very end of Quail Rd and the house has a red roof.
Trucks and trailers HAVE TO ENTER the upper left gravel driveway and turn left. This driveway loops downward. You drive to the lower end and backup your trailer into the graveled area in the corner. Two trucks and trailers can park in this corner. This will allow more room for trucks and trailers to park on the lower gravel. Large trailers over 30ft need to exit out the upper gravel road where you entered.

Guests can contact me through email, text or call my phone.

Children play in the road so drive slowly on Quail Rd. Sometimes the neighbor's little dog will come up the driveway. He is a friendly dog.

Trailers enter at the upper, left gravel driveway and exit at the lower driveway.  Stay on the gravel especially with wet weather because the ground is slippery on the hillside. Don't park in front of the house.  You can drive your ATV on the gravel behind the house and unload at the patio.

sectionedDescription/description:
Relax with the whole family on this peaceful working farm. Enjoy the farm animals and running stream in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains. Tour  the Blue Ridge Parkway or Creeper Trail.   Historic Wythe County, Wohlfahrt Theatre, Abingdon, Barter Theatre, Big Walker Lookout  Shot Tower, Draper Mercantile and so much more. Get unplugged, no distracting internet. Fish in the pond or make smores at the firepit.  Experience the farm with optional homegrown meals/tours. A little piece of heaven.

Beautiful renovated old cottage.

Separate little driveway runs right up to the cottage.
Enjoy sitting out on the upstairs balcony.

Located in Wythe Country, Southwest Virginia. Quiet, peaceful neighborhood, yet close enough to stores, restaurants. Lots of sightseeing and places to tour.
Fish right here in the pond on our farm
Bike, hike or swim.

Easy to explore and travel around by car.
Lots of local hiking and biking trails.
Also rivers for canoeing, tubing, swimming, fishing, etc.

Wonderful fishing in the pond. Catch and release.
Firepit with wood provided.
Beautiful views.
Option to book a mini photo shoot here at the farm during your stay.

primaryHost/about: Hi! I own 2 Airbnb loft apartments in downtown Tazewell, VA. It brings me great joy to host visitors here in beautiful T-Town. I work with coal impacted communities in Southwest VA on Economic Development projects. I can be your personal tourism assistant while you’re visiting Tazewell, just ask!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to entire apartment and balcony.
sectionedDescription/description:
Conveniently located on Main Street Tazewell, you’re within walking distance to 3 full service downtown restaurants, a coffee shop, brewery, boutiques, an art gallery and more! Spacious apartment, featuring a king suite and a second bedroom with a full sized bed. Pull out the futon for additional sleepers, and there’s a full sized couch as well. Kitchen features new appliances and everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals during your stay. Laundry room with washer and dryer for your use.

Built in 1878, this building was the original home to Clinch Valley News. This second story apartment is overflowing with charm & character. Guests have access to a full living room, featuring a sofa, chair and smart TV. An 8 person dining table, full kitchen, bathroom, king suite with a futon and a smart TV, and a full size bed in the second bedroom with a walk in closet.

Full access to entire apartment and balcony.

I am a phone call or text away!

Main Street Tazewell is home to a variety of restaurants and retail shops and is the gateway to the scenic Back of the Dragon. Parking is located in the back of the building, we share a parking lot with the Sheriff’s Department and the Library. There is plenty of safe and private parking.

Parking and entrance to the apartment is located in the back of the building. Turn onto Marion Ave from Main Street and take the left hand turn into the parking lot. The entrance is the white door. You will be given an access code to unlock the door.

WiFi, off street parking, trash pick up, washer and dryer inside apartment.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Please load dishwasher before checking out. Sit full trash bags outside the downstairs entry door for pickup.

name: Opulence ATV Lodge!
sectionedDescription/description: Located at 2264 Cherokee Road, the heart of ATV. Cherokee Road leads to 3 major trails. Indian Ridge Trail head is located approximately 3 minutes from location. Pinnacle Trail connector is located approximately 2 minutes from location. Pocahontas Trail Connecter is located approximately 15 minutes from location.  Outlaw Trails and Stair Steps are approximately 5 minutes from location. 2 mile from Ashland Resort. Enjoy some relaxation by the creek known for trout, fire pit and picnic tables.

name: ATV Riders Choice-Lodging (Welch/Gary area)
sectionedDescription/access:
TRAIL PERMITS:     Purchase permits on line before arrival - 
                                     or purchase in Welch or Bluefield, WV on arrival.

CAUTION:  Drive way is a little steep so be careful when backing out so 
                        your vehicle doesn't drag.
sectionedDescription/description:
Most Popular Rental
Midway between Warrior, Indian,
& Pinnacle Trails -with connector
to Pocahontas Trail. (400 miles to ride)
Garage to lock ATV's

     ⁕     Ample parking 
     ⁕     Ride ATV's anywhere in area. 
     ⁕     Close to Gas & Food.
     ⁕     NEWLY Remodeled.
     ⁕     Charcoal Grill   
     ⁕     4 Roku TV's

✔    PARKING:  Both sides of road, side of house, driveway, or in a locked garage                      
 
 ✔    TURN AROUND SPACE:  1/4 mile past house for extra long trailer.

✔    TRAIL ACCESS:  Only  5  minutes to Warrior Trail on ATV.           
         IOr ride Indian Ridge, Pinnacle, & Pocahontas Trails.  
         (Over 400 miles to ride.)

✔    GAS & FOOD:  Only 2.7 miles to City of Gary (Gas,  Delicious 
       Take-out Food & Golf Course).

✔    GAS & FOOD:  Only 2.5 miles to City of Welch (Gas, Restaurants, 
        Groceries, Parts & Repairs, Hospital, Theatre, Playground, 
        Basketball/Tennis Courts & Outdoor Pool.

HOUSE
✔    NEWLY REMODELED: 3 small bedrooms with 6 single beds.  Each 
        person has their own extra comfortable bed.  

✔    FULL BATH :  NEW tub & shower -  hand held shower wand - &
        extra large bath towels.  

✔    STARTER PACK:  toilet paper, paper towels, detergent, &  
        Keurig Coffee machine and cups.

TRAIL PERMITS:     Purchase permits on line before arrival - 
                                     or purchase in Welch or Bluefield, WV on arrival.

CAUTION:  Drive way is a little steep so be careful when backing out so 
                        your vehicle doesn't drag.

Check-in with a keypad.  
You will receive keypad # once booked.

I  am available 24/7 to answer any questions &
give help in any way to make your stay enjoyable.

Trail stickers can be purchased in Welch at the Little General Store,
 or at the Bantam Market in Welch.  
You can purchase them online before you arrive & save yourself some time.

✔     Quiet neighborhood  just off main road.

✔      Ride ATV or SXS anywhere in area to trails & supplies.


✔       Smack dab in the middle of Warrior Trail, Indian Ridge Trail, & Pinnacle 
          Creek Trails 

✔       Anawalt Lake (fishing) Stocked by State of WV with largemouth bass 
           bluegill, catfish, & trout
           
 ✔       Gary Golf Course

✔  Less than 5 minutes to Warrior Trail.

✔  2  miles to Gary Market (gas, delicious take-out food, snacks).

✔  3  miles to City of Welch (Groceries, Restaurants, Gas, Auto &
       ATV Parts/Repair, Hospital, Theatre, Basketball/Tennis Court, Pool)

✔  No parties are allowed.
 
✔  Two policeman live in the area, so it is a very safe, family friendly 
      area.

✔   Enjoy your stay in Wild, Wonderful West Virginia.

name: Real McCoy Cabins
sectionedDescription/description:
Rustic Luxury Lodging...
Real McCoy Cabins are family owned and operated. Our cabins are top of the line, custom designed by us and hand crafted by local craftsmen.
Tucked away in a private hollow, this is the perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle of city life.
 On premise you will find Real McCoy Country Store and Kitchen featuring home cooked comfort food and desserts as well as convenience items such as beer, wine, snacks, and personal items.
Real McCoy, where even a Hatfield is welcome!

"Rustic Luxury" is exactly what we’ve brought to life here in the historic Town of Pocahontas, Virginia. 
Each cabin has a covered porch, fire pit and charcoal grill outside your door.
Every unit also has an on demand water heater for an endless supply of hot water. No need to wait or end your shower with cold water!

We are located very near two of the best OHV trail systems in the country, West Virginia's Hatfield McCoy Trails and Virginia's Spearhead Trails.
Drive your machine from your cabin to the trails in Bramwell, WV as well as Pocahontas, VA. Pull on up, unhook your trailer and enjoy the ride along ATV-friendly roads. While you’re at it, come on in and have a bite to eat at Real McCoy Country Store and Kitchen where hospitality is alive and well!

At  Real McCoy Cabins, the comfort and convenience of our guests is our first priority.  In order to serve you best, linens are included at no extra charge. There is a also a laundromat on site.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
- Quiet hours 10PM - 7AM

- Pet friendly cabins may be available and require a nonrefundable $65 pet fee. $45 additional for a second pet. 2 animal limit.

name: Burkes Garden Cottage
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Experience the beauty and culture of Southwest Virginia and enjoy the serenity of mountain life in beautiful Burkes Garden. This picturesque farming community sits in the highest valley in Virginia designated a Rural Historic District. Nestled beside the Parsonage Guest House, our cottage called "the Little House" is a vintage 50's cottage but with all the modern conveniences. With one queen and one  double bed it is perfect for 3 to 4 people or a couple's retreat.

The entire house is rented to one party at a time.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: The entire house is rented to one party at a time.

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out- please attempt to reset modem by holding power button for 30 seconds and allowing reboot; prior to contacting Comcast at 1-800-934-6489.
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee per pet. We wll send you a request for additional pet fees. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

name: Spurrier Apt 4 (2 Bed 1 Bath Pets Allowed)
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully updated 2 Bedroom 1 Bathroom Apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities. Free Wifi and just a short ride to all the trail systems. 2 TV's with DVD players & Netflix access. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central air & heat. Pets allowed with additional fee.

This rental has queen beds in both bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests. It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, & new flooring. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of a full-size closets with dressers in both bedrooms.  There is a TV in the living room and one of the bedrooms, with a DVD player at each TV to watch your favorite Red Box movies on. The living room even has a leather duel reclining sofa. Additional perks for this property include the charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio!

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as, Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE Wi-Fi, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.

•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out- please attempt to reset modem by holding power button for 30 seconds and allowing reboot; prior to contacting Comcast at 1-800-934-6489.
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee per pet. We wll send you a request for additional pet fees. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

sectionedDescription/space:
This rental has queen beds in both bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests. It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, & new flooring. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of a full-size closets with dressers in both bedrooms.  There is a TV in the living room and one of the bedrooms, with a DVD player at each TV to watch your favorite Red Box movies on. The living room even has a leather duel reclining sofa. Additional perks for this property include the charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio!

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as, Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE Wi-Fi, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.
sectionedDescription/summary: This beautifully updated 2 Bedroom 1 Bathroom Apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities. Free Wifi and just a short ride to all the trail systems. 2 TV's with DVD players & Netflix access. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central air & heat. Pets allowed with additional fee.

sectionedDescription/description:
Hatfield McCoy Trails #1 Resort is Busted ATV Resort. Located just 300' apart the Hatfield and McCoy Lodge will give your party the space you need to Ride Dirty, Sleep Clean.  With four Kings bedrooms and two queens everyone should feel right at home.  
Busted ATV Resort is conveniently located less than a mile from Bramwells Pocahontas trail#10

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

name: Hazel's Place ATV Riders Hideaway
sectionedDescription/description:
Bring your family and friends to stay at Hazels Place while you're visiting the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.  Leave your trucks and trailers at the house and ride your ATVs and SxSs to the trails from Hazels Place.  You're also able to ride from the house to restaurants, gas stations, grocery stores and much more.  After a rough day on the trail, come back to a beautiful home with 4 bathrooms to clean up in and relax by the circular firepit.  Full Kitchen available for feasts.

Lorton Lick Road, between Bluewell and Montcalm, WV

1/3 acre parking lot
can ride ATVs / SxSs to the trails from the property

sectionedDescription/description:
The Black Diamond ATV Lodge in Welch, WV is the perfect place to stage your next Hatfield McCoy trails adventure.  Consider this your second home as you will have the whole house just for you.  On the main floor there are 3 bedrooms, living room, dining, kitchen, laundry, and bath. See guidebook for more details.

The whole house plus the garage is yours to use

Full access

email at blackdiamondwelchwv@gmail.com

Three major trail heads close by copies of Hatfield maps can be emailed as well as picked up at any pass retailer there are copies in the living room (please leave for the next guest)

Lots of parking  can accommodate three trucks and trailers

Cameras aren’t in use after check in

name: The Company House of Pocahontas
photos/14/caption: Bedroom 3
photos/16/caption: Bedroom 3
photos/23/caption: Bedroom 4

photos/25/caption: The 2 lane, paved, and lit alley behind the house
photos/26/caption: The paved driveway behind the house
sectionedDescription/access: Guests get the whole house and the surrounding yard.
sectionedDescription/description:
Guests may use the entire house, 184 E. Water St., the yard, and the driveway. 
The house was built in 1883 and was occupied by my grandparents, my father actually grew up in this house. This was a Pocahontas Fuel company house.

The house has a living room, dining room, kitchen, four bedrooms, and 1.5 bathrooms. There is a large front porch with rocking chairs and a swing. A mudroom is off of the kitchen. You’re welcome to park in the driveway behind the house and put ATVs in the roped off area of the backyard. Trailers and trucks must be parked in the alley, but please don’t block the alley. Cars can be parked in front of the house.

Guests get the whole house and the surrounding yard.

I live 5 miles away so I am readily available. My phone number is 843–801– 2515. You can either call me or text and I keep my phone available at all times when I have a renter

Pocahontas is an ATV friendly town during day light hours. Please be considerate of noise, this house is in a residential section and the town quiet hours are 10 PM to 7 AM. Also please be respectful of Sunday morning church hours

There is a lockbox on the front door with two door keys in it. I will text you the code for the lock box once the house has been cleaned from the previous renters. The gate to the backyard has a lock on it and the key is hanging on a nail in the kitchen beside the back door. When you are leaving please put the gate key back on that nail and put the door keys back in the lock box.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: The town of Pocahontas requires that all trailers and ATV must be parked behind the house in the alley. Cars and trucks may park on the street in front of the house. I allow parking in my gated back yard and also in the driveway beside my garage
sectionedDescription/interaction: I live 5 miles away so I am readily available. My phone number is 843–801– 2515. You can either call me or text and I keep my phone available at all times when I have a renter

name: Cozy Two Bedroom Apartment located in Welch
photos/14/caption: Guests have access to the front yard
primaryHost/about: My wife Elise and I have lived in McDowell County since November 2015. We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. It is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the modern and vintage charm of our 1920's home. Located in the heart of McDowell County in Welch, West Virginia. We take pride in offering the most comfortable hypoallergenic bedding for a wonderful night's sleep and the softest towels so our guests will have a lavish experience.

This apartment is located in a home with an additional unit across the hall and it is above another apartment. It is located across the way from City Hall and the Welch Library.

We thoroughly clean and disinfect after each guest's stay. The cleaners and detergents used on our property are eco-friendly, sustainable and biodegradable.

Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. It is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.

As hosts, we are always available for any assistance and advice while guests navigate the area.

There is truly no other place like Welch, WV. Once a booming coal town, Welch now has a much smaller population. Welch and McDowell County have garnered much attention over the past decade. The New York Times and CNN have published and produced different pieces highlighting the county and its unique way of life that still exists here in the mountains. Even the late chef, author, and documentarian, Anthony Bourdain spent time filming in McDowell and was quoted saying it was one of the most unique places he had traveled to.
 https://www.wvpress.org/breaking-news/anthony-bourdain-mcdowell-best-place-earth/

You can see McDowell County's episode on season 11 of Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

This home is within walking distance to a gas station, a library, town hall and the movie theatre. The Jack Caffrey Arts and Culture Center is a short distance away. Small shops, grocery stores and restaurants are all one to five miles away. There is a Bluefield Area Transit Bus route that runs through town on weekdays.

There is no kitchen in this unit. There is a key code for the front door of the house and for the apartment door. There are stairs  leading to this apartment.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
We prefer no shoes in the apartment. 
Please leave beds unmade.
sectionedDescription/interaction: As hosts, we are always available for any assistance and advice while guests navigate the area.

primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
The Main Lodge is only rented to one group at a time. Only Your group will be inhabiting the house during your stay.  Our beautiful 5 bed room, 2 bath + bonus room with lounge is # 1 in Hatfield McCoy lodging. Visit our social media pages for a video walk through and keep up with the latest up dates to the  Busted Atv Resort  2000+ square foot Main Lodge. Holiday weekends are three night minimum.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.
sectionedDescription/description:
Ride dirty, Sleep clean! Busted ATV Resort offers you the very best in accommodations to ride the Hatfield McCoy trails.

The remodeled historic 1880 Bramwell House and adjacent  accommodations at the base of Mt. Me offer spacious accommodations with parking. Just a mile from Hatfield McCoy trail head and 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park and  Look Out is just one mile from our front door.

The Main Lodge is only rented to one group at a time. Only Your group will be inhabiting the house during your stay.  Our beautiful 5 bed room, 2 bath + bonus room with lounge is # 1 in Hatfield McCoy lodging. Visit our social media pages for a video walk through and keep up with the latest up dates to the  Busted Atv Resort  2000+ square foot Main Lodge. Holiday weekends are three night minimum.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

Please feel free to call or text anytime.

The Busted ATV Resort is owned and operated by ATV nuts, for ATV nuts. Offering you the comforts of home including everything you need for the perfect stay.
 
Main lodge -Central heat and air, ceiling fans, wifi, smart streaming Tv's, large front porch, plenty of parking for your ATVs and Trailers, outdoor boot wash station,  Turbo Master Boot Dryer, laundry and more.

Winter Rates (November  13th - March 18th) are special accommodations that you must first contact us for availability and pricing before booking will be accepted . 

Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a Great Price In-season months (April - October)is by Winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to use the Resort contact us first. We require a 90 day notice on Bookings from mid November to Mid March.   Don't forget to follow us online for the latest info on Busted.

primaryHost/about: Will and Amy. Faith, Family, Farming.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.
sectionedDescription/description:
You will relax and reconnect in this beautiful valley nestled in the Southwest Virginia mountains. Sit on the porch and soak up those mountain views. Relax in the hot tub and count the stars. Reconnect with your spouse as you unplug from the hustle and bustle. Rest, laugh, enjoy! 

The cabin is located on a working family farm. You can purchase beef, pork, and chicken to cook while you’re here or bring a cooler and take some home.

Take a break from life. Get away. Come relax in solitude or with your spouse. Reconnect with nature. Breathe in that fresh air. Observe wildlife and get a taste of life on the farm.

The cabin completely private, but if you’d like to visit with family or friends there is another cabin located on the farm too. Check out our other listing for Valley View Cabin. You cannot see the other cabin, but it is located a couple hundred yards away.

You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.

We are available by phone (call or text) if you need anything.  We can offer suggestions of things to do while here (folder of information in the cabin). If we’re around we’d be happy to show you around the farm.

We are about a mile off of Hwy 16 (Back of the Dragon). About 10 miles from Hungry Mother State Park (hiking, fishing, beach swimming area...). We’re 25 minutes from Marion where there is an adorable Main Street with shops and eateries.  We are about 45 minutes from Abingdon (Barter Theatre, antique shopping, dining, winery...).

We are not near any public transportation.

We are about 25 minutes away from town. So, you may want to plan to stop at the grocery store on your way in. There are plenty of great restaurants in Marion. (We have a list of restaurants and activities to do while here.) FYI: Many of the Marion shops/restaurants are CLOSED on Mondays!

On our farm we raise and sell pastured beef, chicken, and pork. If you plan to cook while you are here let us know and you can order some homegrown meat ahead of time and we will have it waiting in your fridge. (Sausage or bacon for breakfast, steaks, hamburger, chicken breast, pork chops...) Bring a cooler so you can take some beef, chicken, and pork back home with you. You can see what's available and order directly through our website www.oldrichvalleyfarm dot com.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Hot tubs are very expensive.  We ask that you read and follow all rules of the hot tub (listed in the cabin) to make sure it doesn’t get damaged.  

This is a working farm. We ask that you are very careful around the animals and stay off of all farm equipment.

primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)
sectionedDescription/description:
This is the best sleeping room in the house. Hot water radiator heat keeps the room warm in the winter and concrete floors keep it comfortably cool in the summer. There's access to a full bath with tub and shower but you must walk up a flight of stairs. I also try to keep the house as free from allergens/fragrances as possible for guests who have sensitivities (noted in House Rules below).

The wi-fi is very poor in the bedroom but great in the parlor room just down the hall.

Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)

I'm in and out of the spaces with shared access but your bed and bath are always private. I like to socialize and interact with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

There's a great little biking road about 1/4 mile from my home that lots of bikers love to ride. About 5 miles away is a great mountain bike trail at the Blfd WV city park. For more serious bikers, there's the Burkes Garden trail. 
For hikers, Lincolnshire Park, about 13 miles away in Tazewell, has features so beautiful you will think you're in the The Hobbit's  "Shire." 
For other things to do and places to eat, see my Guidebook section of Guest Resources.

The Town of Bluefield, Va. operates Graham Transit. Graham Transit runs three deviated fixed routes throughout the area each day. I am a 5 minute walk from the closest bus route stop.  Bus route schedules are listed on the Town of Bluefield, Va. official website.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price.

name: A Bit of Heaven Rental-Cove House-Warrior Trail
photos/0/caption:
Newly Renovated very nice, clean, spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bath, kitchen and living room house. Perfect fit for large groups or small. Convenient for riding HMT trails or outlaw trails.
Quiet neighborhood plenty of parking for trucks and trailers.
photos/1/caption: Spacious living room with a large sectional sofa and extra seating.  Plenty of comfy seating to lounge around  after a day on the trails. Also includes a futon couch that can be used for additional sleeping arrangements.
photos/2/caption: Amenities include a 65" flatscreen TV with Roku access (Netflix, Prime, etc), high speed Wifi and a designated work space.
photos/3/caption:
Fully equipped, large eat in kitchen. 
Perfect for large groups or a small family to dine in during your stay.
photos/5/caption: Maybe one of the most important things in the house. The coffee pot! Both a single serve as well as a regular pot. If you are like me we gotta have our coffee.
photos/6/caption: Bedroom #1 has 2 queen size comfy beds. Extra blankets and fresh linens. It also has a walk in closet and an on Suite adjoining bathroom.
photos/7/caption:
On suite adjoining bathroom with bedroom #1. Clean towels,
Fully stocked with all the necessities soap, shampoo, etc.
photos/8/caption: On suite bathroom 5' ceramic tiled walk in shower for bedroom #1.
photos/9/caption: Bedroom #2 Sleeps 3. 1 comfy queen size bed and 1 single bed. Clean linens and extra blankets. Clothes hanging rod with hangers.
photos/10/caption: 2nd bathroom shared by bedroom two and 3. Fully stocked necessities hair dryer, soap, shampoo, etc.
photos/11/caption: 2nd bathroom 36" ceramic tiled walk in shower.
photos/12/caption: Bedroom #3 has 2 comfy full size beds. Clean linens and extra blankets. Clothes hanging rods with hangers.
photos/13/caption: Laundry area extra large drum washer and dryer to wash riding clothes. Comes complete with laundry soap and a iron.
photos/14/caption: Yes it's true! We have parking to accommodate your trucks, trailers and equipment.
photos/15/caption: Entrance off of War Cove Circle. Well lit with security lights.
photos/16/caption: Covered Patio/Porch with outdoor seating and a gas grill. Perfect for sitting out at night and watching the stars.
photos/17/caption: Enjoy the evenings sitting by the fire pit talking and spending quality time with your family and friends. There's also a set of corn hole boards in the master closet.
photos/18/caption: Electronic lock for easy check in when you arrive.
photos/19/caption: Exterior security cameras for added security
photos/20/caption: Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers
photos/21/caption: Entrance to the house off of War Cove Circle
photos/24/caption:
Rick and I own A Scoop of Heaven
Best icecream in town. Open seasonally April-October. THU-SAT  from 12-9pm. Stop by and say hey and get a 10% discount.
photos/25/caption: ATV friendly town off load when you get here and drive you ATV where ever you want to go. The Owl serves inexpensive but tasty breakfast, lunch and dinner 6 days a week and lunch and opens at noon on Sundays.
photos/26/caption: Warrior Trailhead office sells HMT passes as well as souvenirs. Located on River Rd. Open from 9am-2pm everyday.
primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest has full access to the house and yard. This property also has a Suite on the backside of the house that can be purchased along with or seperate.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart... 

Surrounded by mountains and located right around the corner from Hatfield McCoys Warrior Trailhead.
Enjoy High Rocks, Wilmore Dam, or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, or hiking. 
Easy access to restaurants, gas and grocery store.  We are an ATV friendly town and house is located in friendly quiet Neighborhood with plenty of parking for trucks and trailers.

The Main house features 3 Bedrooms, 2 full baths, open kitchen-dining room, living room and laundry area. It sleeps up to 13 and is fully equipped with clean linens, towels and bedding.
The Master Bedroom has a private Bath with a large tiled shower. The main bathroom is shared between the 2 remaining bedrooms.

Living room has a 65" flat screen TV with Roku access (Netfix, Prime, etc.) and WIFI. It also has a sectional sofa, extra seating, and a small desk workspace. 

Fully equipped kitchen with dishes, flatware and kitchen utensils . Large covered front porch with a Bbq grill and outdoor seating. Fire ring in the yard for those cool evenings back at the house.
This House has a suite on the backside that can be rented with or separate from the House.
Like us on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.

Guest has full access to the house and yard. This property also has a Suite on the backside of the house that can be purchased along with or seperate.

Our mission is to make your stay at The Cove House as enjoyable as possible. 

We live locally and respect your privacy.  We'll give you the space that you want or the help you might need.

Located on the entrance to Hatfield McCoys Warrior Trail with direct connections to Pinnacle Creek, Indian Ridge and Pocahantas Trail. Located off 16 WV part of the 91 mile Head of the Dragon Motorcycle Ride, in McDowell County.

Quiet Neighborhood in a welcoming small town with all the conveniences Restaurants,  Grocery store  and gas station.

War is a ATV friendly town, so you can feel free to ride your ATV everywhere during the duration of your stay  or directly to the trail head with no trailering

Day trips in the area:
86 Miles to New River Gorge
64 Miles to Beckley Exibition Coal Miner Youth Museum

**Check out our other Listings**

The Calvary House

Up to (1) dog per accommodation is permitted (with the exception of Pit Bulls or Pit Mixes, which are expressly prohibited) with a nonrefundable $50 cleaning fee, and the guest must agree to and abide by the Hotel Pet Policy & Agreement form.

name: Room 1 at Bramwell Adventures-2 Min to Trail!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront, pet-friendly* rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails. If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby. *See Pet Policy in House Rules.

Room 1 is a single-room efficiency on the riverfront with kitchenette, private bathroom and shower, 2 full beds, and 1 twin bed over a double bunk for a maximum capacity of 7 guests. The kitchenette is equipped with a compact refrigerator, 2-eye hotplate, dishes, pots, pans, cooking and eating utensils, coffee pot, and microwave oven.  Rooms 1 and 2 are connected by a lockout door and may be rented together for a party of up to 12. WiFi is included, as well as onsite parking for trailers, trucks, and ATVs at no additional cost to our guests.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  Pets require an additional cleaning fee and guests must agree to pet policy.  (See House Rules for details.)  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out please contact (304)-589-5789
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully updated 2 full-bed 1-bath apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities, free Wi-Fi, and a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central heat & air. Pets allowed with additional per-pet fee. You will be just a short ride to all the Hatfield/McCoy trail systems.

***FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL***

ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

2 Bedroom Apartment *Bluewell Area*

GPS Address: 219 Spurrier Rd., Bluefield, WV 24701

Everything you need in one place!
Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?
If so, you have found the right place!

Spurrier Apt. 1
This rental has a full bed in both of the two bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests.

It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, new flooring, and leather dual-reclining sofa in the living room. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator, and charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of full-sized closets with dressers in both bedrooms. There is a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each to watch your favorite Red Box movies on.

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE WIFI, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

Contactless check-in and check-out is a must. You are emailed your door code and once inside you have an extra security door lock.
• 3:00PM check-in / 11:00AM check-out

Units are only available for out-of-town guests or corporate and business professionals looking for a temporary place to stay in the area.

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out please contact (304)-589-5789
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.

sectionedDescription/access: Guest had full access to the house andside yard. This property also had an adjoining property on the front that can be booked as a combination for large groups or booked seperate.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart...
Surrounded by mountains and located right around the corner from the Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trailhead office.
Enjoy High Rocks, Wilmore Dam or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, hiking or boating. 
Easy access to restaurants, gas station, and grocery store. We are an ATV friendly town and House is located in quiet friendly neighborhood with plenty of parking.

Features 2 bedrooms, 1 full bath with washer and dryer, Eat in galley kitchen living room.
it sleeps 6 and is fully equipped with clean linens, towels and bedding.
The bathroom features a 36" ceramic tile shower. 
Livingroom has a 55" Roku flat screen TV and Wifi. It also has a sofa and chair.
Fully equipped kitchen with dishes, flatware and kitchen utensils. Covered front porch with Bbq grill and outdoor seating. 
Look us up on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.

Guest had full access to the house andside yard. This property also had an adjoining property on the front that can be booked as a combination for large groups or booked seperate.

very quiet Neighborhood

ATV friendly town, you are welcome e to ride your ATV in town.

** Check out our other listings**
The Calvary House
The Cove House
The Cove Suite

primaryHost/about: I have been in the vacation rental business for over 25 years! I love rescuing old wood, restoring antiques, collecting vintage clothing, and am always on the hunt for unusual finds. Decorating is a passion as well. I seem to find a place for everything! Beyond that, I love meeting and welcoming people from all over the world. I would love to add you to my list!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: During the day, guests may enjoy a walk to the barn in the lower pastures (following the designated path only). There you can access the river and fish (bring your own fishing pole and/or kayak) or have fun just splashing around! This area is restricted to day use only and no ATVs or dirt bikes are allowed on the property. No sport shooting on property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This historic cabin and farm has been featured in numerous print articles and 'Traveling West Virginia' TV segments.  Filled with glimpses of the past, guests enjoy charming antique-filled rooms, Wi-Fi, kitchen, new bath, queen bed, fireplace.  Near the New River Gorge National Park, Pipestem zipline, ATV trails, hiking, kayaking, caves/caverns & more. Watch deer graze in the pastures as you sit back and enjoy peace in the valley. Located just off I-77, exit 14. A step back in time ...

Guests will enjoy the whole house. Historic home is smoke free, pet free, and vape free. Each room is appointed with beautiful antique quilts, old trunks, and pieces of furniture used on the farm. It is like a museum! Of course, there has been added the modern recliner for sitting and sipping coffee while watching the deer eat apples from the old tree!

The main floor has a sunporch with a spectacular view of the valley. Guests can enjoy views of sunrise and sunset in both rain and shine! The main floor also has a kitchen, dining area, living room with fireplace, and sitting room. Beautiful tiled bathroom with shower is on main floor.  Choose to sleep on main floor or in loft. The loft has a queen size bed, sitting area, and closet. All rooms have antiques and beautiful furnishings.

If you are looking for pampered, modern conveniences this is not your place. If you want peace, quiet, tranquility amid old relics, antiques, and farm pastures you will enjoy this property. The homestead is much like it was during the time it was built (early 1900s). It is intended to give visitors and guests an idea of how living on the farm in the early years might have been. Not for the allergy sensitive as it is a farm with hayfields, etc.

Please note: This is an old cabin on a septic system in the countryside.  For safety reasons, we strictly enforce the use of it to 2 people ONLY. We do not share/offer property as a meeting or gathering place.

During the day, guests may enjoy a walk to the barn in the lower pastures (following the designated path only). There you can access the river and fish (bring your own fishing pole and/or kayak) or have fun just splashing around! This area is restricted to day use only and no ATVs or dirt bikes are allowed on the property. No sport shooting on property.

You may text me with questions at any time.

This property is located in the countryside surrounded by mountains and valleys. There are 2 churches (Methodist and Baptist), a post office, a school (K-5), and a small convenience store w gas/groceries is 3 miles away. This property is near Camp Creek State Forest, Pipestem, Bluestone State Parks, Pinnacle Rock State Park, outdoor rafting, ATV riding on the Hatfields and McCoys Trail, America's newest National park: The New River Gorge National Park, and much more! It takes approximately 5 minutes to reach Interstate 77 from the cabin, exit 14.

You will need transportation to get to everything to see and do. There is no public transit system in the countryside. :)

Diesel the farm dog may be around each day for his dog biscuit.
We love sharing our family's old log cabin with others. We strictly enforce the use of the cabin to no more than 2 adults, no pets.

priceDetails/0/value: $10 per night after the first guest
primaryHost/about: My wife Elise and I have lived in McDowell County since November 2015. We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. The apartment is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy our newly remodeled apartment in the heart of historic Welch. This unit was designed with the traveling professional in mind; quiet, easily accessible and comfortable.

Our spacious one bedroom is the perfect getaway for travelers to the area. Whether you are a nurse, teacher, other working professional or are just looking to stay in Welch, this is the place for you. 

We offer optimal Wi-Fi and have a television with a Roku for your viewing pleasure. 

A fully equipped kitchen and pleasant dining room will cater to any culinary needs.

Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. The apartment is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.

There is truly no other place like Welch, WV. Once a booming coal town, Welch now has a much smaller population. Welch and McDowell County have garnered much attention over the past decade. The New York Times and CNN have published and produced different pieces highlighting the county and its unique way of life that still exists here in the mountains. Even the late chef, author, and documentarian, Anthony Bourdain spent time filming in McDowell and was quoted saying it was one of the most unique places he had traveled to.
 https://www.wvpress.org/breaking-news/anthony-bourdain-mcdowell-best-place-earth/

You can see McDowell County's episode on season 11 of Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

This home is within walking distance to a gas station, a library, town hall and the movie theatre. The Jack Caffrey Arts and Culture Center is a short distance away. Small shops, grocery stores and restaurants are all one to five miles away. There is a Bluefield Area Transit Bus route that runs through town on weekdays.

There are stairs leading up to the house and upon entry, there are stairs leading to the unit.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please leave beds unmade.
We prefer no shoes in the apartment.

name: Hatfield @ Busted ATV Resort
primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
For those of you that Ride Dirty , Sleep Clean  - thank you!  Your Busted experience on Mt Me. is created by You for You. It has been with your help that the oldest house in Bramwell is rejuvenated to it's original 1880 beauty. With your continued support My great friend Rob and I will continue to build Busted A in way that's perfect for all our needs. God bless!
Pat

The Hatfield offers you the comforts of home. Three bedrooms , two baths a kitchen and living space that is ready for your group.  Remember to ride dirty but sleep clean in the Hatfield@ Busted ATV Resort We're just a mile from the Bramwell trail head that enters Hatfield McCoy's - Pocahontas , Indian Ridge , Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trails. Want more trails? Virginia Spearhead Trail system is just a five mile ride away.   If the historic Main Lodge and McCoy lodge are already booked than the Hatfield offers you the next best choice in the Hatfield McCoy territory. Hatfield now offers you a Turbo Master 4000 boot drier.
Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

For driving directions just enter (Busted ATV Resort) into your favorite mapping app.

Riding dirty on your ATV of course

Winter Rates and special accommodations opening up for next winter 2019 . 

Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a great price in-season months (April - October) is by winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to stay at Busted ATV Resort contact us first. We require a 30 day notice on Bookings from mid November to Mid March. Don't forget to follow us on Facebook for the latest info on Busted.

Guests may have up additional visitors (not overnight). Please use caution with outdoor Firepit - do NOT leave embers burning. All fire pit embers must be extinguished and not left unattended.  Indoor fireplace is gas logs only.  Please park in the designated parking only.  Do not drive or park in the yard.  Absolutely no smoking inside of the house.  You are welcome to smoke outside but please dispose of butts properly - not in the yard.

primaryHost/about:
I have been in professional vacation rental management for 20 years - and before that the hotel industry.  I am formerly from Bluefield WV and this home sits on my family farm.  Materials for the home was farmed from the surrounding property, milled on my fathers sawmill and loving crafted.  The hard wood floors were reclaimed from an old local store from the early 1900's.  

I love to travel and when I do I look for the places where I can live like a local.  I want to step back, meet the people, eat the food and see what it really means to live "there".  

This home is nothing fancy.  If you are looking for upscale accommodations - this is not it.  This is my country retreat - a place I go to sit on the porch, listen to the frogs, build a fire outside or take a walk in the woods.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back to the Heart of Appalachia on a farm that has been in my family for the last 75 years.  Sitting on 40 acres, convenient to the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System (8 miles away ) - this property allows you to enjoy the mountains without roughing it!

Enjoy horse shoes, corn hole, volleyball and hiking during your visit.  A propane grill is available for your use on the large back deck.  This property has been home to three generations of farmers who have loved the land and all it provided.  In the 1940's moonshine was still rampantly produced in Appalachia and this property was the site of several family still operations.  This home sits just 250 ft off the main roadway.

I will be available by phone for emergencies.  There is a caretaker that lives next door to the property and can assist in an emergency.

This location is very rural residential.  Although you have access to roam the recommended trails - please use caution as this is Appalachian woodlands.   Please do not cut any trees on property.  Firewood is provided for use in the outdoor fire pit.

No ATV riding is allowed on the property.  Trails are available to hikers and mountain bikers only.

You can drive an ATV along the shoulder of a highway or road for up to 10 miles at a speed of 25 miles per hour or less.  There is trail access within 8 miles of the property so you may park your trailers and ride the ATV to the trail head from this property.

You will have access to a fully equipped kitchen.  A regular coffee maker as well as a Keurig is available for your use.  There are TV's in the living room and Master bedroom.  These TV's are not cable enabled.  Wi-Fi is available.  Please note that the property does not have municipal water service - water is furnished by a well.  Air conditioning is available in all bedrooms.

primaryHost/about: I moved to West Virginia about 15 years ago. I love the beauty of this state with its mountains and rivers. I also love the old houses in Bluefield that were built a century ago to accommodate all those who prospered by working for the railroad, which was essential to the transport of coal. I undertook a major renovation of the home that contains the apartment we call the Railroad Express Guest Suite. The house has good bones and beautiful hardwood floors and was worth the effort!
sectionedDescription/access: Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the king bed in this newly renovated private guest suite with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, armoire, dresser and nightstands. Eat-in kitchen has microwave, fridge & induction cooktop. Porch is perfect for dining or relaxing. Convenient to Hatfield-McCoy Trails & historic Bramwell. RR enthusiasts will love Bluefield, a town that flourished when Norfolk & Western came to town in the 1880s. List of railroad museums, landmarks and depots can be made available upon request at check in.

High-speed wifi is provided.  Two windows, with screens, can be opened. The king mattress and pillows have allergy protective covers. An air mattress is available for children accompanying adults. Contact host if more than two guests are involved. Off street parking is available. Keypad entry.

Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.

Host is nearby. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask! On longer stays, we will be in to clean the suite at least once every two weeks.

Are you a railroad enthusiast? Bluefield prospered as a center for the railroad transport of coal.  Norfolk Southern still maintains an office at 800 Princeton Avenue in downtown Bluefield. The city offers many vantage points for photography, with spots where you can pull off the road and take spectacular photos as the trains rumble by. Of interest to children: The Ridgerunner train leaves on a milelong loop, from noon to 6 p.m. on weekends, from Bluefield City Park from April through September, but be careful: That train whistle is loud! For researchers and scholars, a wealth of information is tucked away in the Eastern Regional Coal Archives, which are attached to the Craft Memorial Library in Bluefield, including railroad memorabilia, maps, company records and historic photographs and documents.

Both Bluefield, West Virginia, and Bluefield, Virginia, have extensive bus service. The driveway is large enough to accommodate a trailer. 
ATV parking may be arranged off-site.

Contact host for parking instructions and keypad code.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: ADDITIONAL GUESTS -- contact host if you would like to add a third person to your stay. UPON CHECKOUT -- no need to wash linens, just please text or message host when you leave. Long-term guests may do light housekeeping (cleaning supplies provided), but hosts will arrange to enter the suite at least once every two weeks to clean.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Host is nearby. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask! On longer stays, we will be in to clean the suite at least once every two weeks.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Are you a railroad enthusiast? Bluefield prospered as a center for the railroad transport of coal.  Norfolk Southern still maintains an office at 800 Princeton Avenue in downtown Bluefield. The city offers many vantage points for photography, with spots where you can pull off the road and take spectacular photos as the trains rumble by. Of interest to children: The Ridgerunner train leaves on a milelong loop, from noon to 6 p.m. on weekends, from Bluefield City Park from April through September, but be careful: That train whistle is loud! For researchers and scholars, a wealth of information is tucked away in the Eastern Regional Coal Archives, which are attached to the Craft Memorial Library in Bluefield, including railroad memorabilia, maps, company records and historic photographs and documents.
sectionedDescription/notes: Contact host for parking instructions and keypad code.
sectionedDescription/space: High-speed wifi is provided.  Two windows, with screens, can be opened. The king mattress and pillows have allergy protective covers. An air mattress is available for children accompanying adults. Contact host if more than two guests are involved. Off street parking is available. Keypad entry.
sectionedDescription/summary: Enjoy the king bed in this newly renovated private guest suite with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, armoire, dresser and nightstands. Eat-in kitchen has microwave, fridge & induction cooktop. Porch is perfect for dining or relaxing. Convenient to Hatfield-McCoy Trails & historic Bramwell. RR enthusiasts will love Bluefield, a town that flourished when Norfolk & Western came to town in the 1880s. List of railroad museums, landmarks and depots can be made available upon request at check in.
sectionedDescription/transit:
Both Bluefield, West Virginia, and Bluefield, Virginia, have extensive bus service. The driveway is large enough to accommodate a trailer. 
ATV parking may be arranged off-site.

name: Private Luxury Cabin located on the H&M Trails!
photos/14/caption: Master Bedroom
photos/16/caption: Bedroom 2
sectionedDescription/description:
Hidden Hollow ATV Ranch is located on the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas trail system just outside of Montcalm, WV. We are positioned conveniently on the Pocahontas connector trail with access to our private 90 acre ranch via a ½ mile private dirt road.  We are perfect for couples or families looking for a more privacy and seclusion than the typical large resort or campground.  

Included with your stay are:

Linens/Pillows
Free Firewood
Free Ice
Satellite TV
Wifi
Pet Friendly 
2A Friendly

The cabin and its location is geared towards the off road community.

Cabin is located on 90 acres with no other guests but you!  Owners and property manager do live on the premises as well.

ATVs can be driven on all roads in the area

Need extra room?  We offer a 50A Full RV hookup next to the cabin for an additional fee.

Please note:  Property Manager lives onsite in nearby house.  We respect your privacy and we are riders as well.

After 2/1/2022 the second bedroom will no longer contain bunk beds.  There will be 2 queen beds in their place.

name: Stay @Tin Roof! Clean 3Bed 2Bath near trailheads
photos/16/caption: Master King
photos/23/caption: 2nd Full Bathroom
photos/24/caption: 3rd Bedroom Queen
primaryHost/about: I am a realtor from coastal NC. I love traveling and do so often!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill
sectionedDescription/description:
The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place. The Tin Roof is located near the Hatfield McCoy trails where you have multiple trailheads to choose from. No need to load your trailer, ride your ATV directly from this location. Tin Roof is 37 miles from Winterplace for the ski bunnies!  Multiple lakes for a day in the kayak , hiking trails to get in your steps , and several restaurants to enjoy;  all located close by! Two living rooms and plenty of space!

Three trucks and Three trailers ( depending on length) will fit in driveway. All three bedrooms have large beds and room for all your gear! Two living rooms  2 Tv’s and plenty of eating space at the kitchen island or dining table. A full laundry room, front  deck with outdoor eating area, and a fire pit in the backyard for evening relaxing!  For your convenience there is a permanent charcoal grill. The Keurig and crockpot are a few of the extra additions to the kitchen that will make your stay easy!  Basic cable in the living room and smart TV in the den . Brand new mattresses , furniture installed September 2021.  Towels , Hand Towels , washcloths, and all bed linens included.  Fully stocked kitchen with dishes , cups , and cooking utensils.

Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill

Fee free to message with any questions or suggestions!

Tin Roof is located in an ATV friendly town where you can drive your ATV to restaurants , gas stations and trailheads.  Located minutes from Various trail heads as well as restaurants. We are also near Bluefield University and a short trip to the VA line . As well as a short drive to a nearby airport.

While public transportation may be sparse, vehicles, ATV’s and hiking are no issues to get around.

This property is adjacent to  a main road HWY 52, and less than a mile from Lorton Lick rd, we also live off a small quiet road. We ask that you respect our neighbors and refrain from parties or disruptive behavior. You can access HWY 52 from our front yard with an atv , please stay to the left of the rock/boulders which mark our property line. Toilet paper , paper towels , shampoo and soap are provided. Coffee , sugar and honey for your first morning will also be available . Laundry detergent, dish detergent, and sponges. Ready for your arrival !

sectionedDescription/description:
We invite you to kick back and enjoy a taste of the country life while visiting beautiful Appalacia.  One hundred year old farm house that is newly renovated on 16 acres of Appalachian hardwood forest and pasture land and situated just 2.5 miles from the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System and 30 minutes to Winterplace.  Located centrally between the cities Bluefield and Princeton, while being conveniently located two miles from Bluewell and just six miles from historic Bramwell, WV.

Beautiful 16 acres for wooded landscape cover with chicory plants which Bluefield was named after.

name: Bramwell Hill Manor
sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Hill Manor is ATV friendly house over looking the town of Bramwell WV and is  located 1/4 mile from the Hatfield McCoy's Pocahontas ATV Trailhead and 4 miles from the Original Pocahontas Trail on Virginia's Spearhead trail system. The house is furnished with towels and liens. The kitchen has everything you need for cooking or use the BBQ grill on the covered patio. The house has WIFI and cable TV. 

Over 4 guests is an additional $25.00 per guest per night.

I will available in case you need something or have questions..

The house is located 1/4 mile from the Pocahontas Trail head.

You can drive your ATV to the trailheads on the highway from the house.
